Umineko Project (UP): All that could be heard was the sound of the rain, the voices from the kids' television program that Maria was watching, and the engrossed Maria's cackling voice.
Steam (ST): All that could be heard was the sound of the rain, the voices from the kids' TV program Maria was watching, and the engrossed Maria's cackling voice.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 聞こえるのは、雨の音と、真里亞が見続けているテレビの幼児番組の音声、そしてそれに夢中でけたけたと笑い続けている真里亞の声だけだった。
Russian (RU): Звук дождя, голоса из детской телепередачи, которую смотрела Мария, и гогочущий голос самой увлёкшейся Марии, вот и всё, что было слышно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tudo o que podia ser ouvido era o som da chuva, as vozes das crianças do programa de televisão que Maria estava assistindo e a voz entretida de Maria, gargalhando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 能聽到的只有雨聲，真里亞一直在看的電視中幼兒節目的聲音，以及正看得入迷笑個不停的真里亞的聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 能听到的只有雨声，真里亚一直在看的电视中幼儿节目的声音，以及正看得入迷笑个不停的真里亚的声音。
Italian (IT): Tutto ciò che si poteva udire era il suono della pioggia, le voci provenienti dal programma per bambini che Maria, assorbita dal televisore, stava guardando,{n}e le sue risatine sghignazzanti.
Turkish (TR): Duyulabilen tek şey yağmurun sesi, Maria'nın izlediği çocuk televizyon programından gelen sesler, ve kendini kaptırmış Maria'nın kıkırdayan sesiydi.

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, ......what greeted them as they returned dumbfounded from that horrible, bizarre scene, was the voice of Maria as she rolled around laughing at the television...
Steam (ST): In other words, what greeted them as they returned dumbfounded from that horrible, bizarre scene... was the voice of Maria as she rolled around laughing at the TV...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, what greeted them as they returned dumbfounded from that horrible, bizarre scene was the voice of Maria as she rolled around laughing at the television...
PC Japanese (JP): だからつまり、……この世のものとは思えない惨状を目にして呆然としながら帰ってきた彼らを迎えたのは、テレビに笑い転げる真里亞の笑い声だったことになる…。
Russian (RU): Другими словами, первое, что встретило их, вернувшихся шокированными той ужасной, незабываемой сценой, был голос Марии, покатывающейся со смеху перед телевизором...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, ......quando eles voltaram perplexos daquela horrível e bizarra cena, foram cumprimentados pela voz de Maria, enquanto ela rolava de rir em frente à televisão...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以也就是說，……一群人在目睹了根本不是這個世上會有的慘狀後，迎接神情恍惚的他們回來的，正是看著電視笑翻天的真里亞的笑聲…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以也就是说，……一群人在目睹了根本不是这个世上会有的惨状后，迎接神情恍惚的他们回来的，正是看着电视笑翻天的真里亚的笑声…。
Italian (IT): In altre parole... ciò che li accolse al loro ritorno, sconvolti da quel macabro spettacolo che non sembrava reale, era la voce di Maria, che si rotolava per terra dalle risate davanti alla TV...
Turkish (TR): Başka bir deyişle, ......o korkunç, garip sahneden şaşkın halde döndüklerinde onları karşılayan şey, televizyonun karşısında kahkahalar atarak yuvarlanan Maria'nın sesiydi...

Umineko Project (UP): Not knowing how to explain to Maria that her mother, Rosa, was dead, those who returned to the room couldn't manage any more than a suffocating silence.
Steam (ST): Those who returned to the room didn't know how to explain to Maria that her mother was dead...and were trapped by a suffocating silence.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Without knowing how explain to Maria that her mother, Rosa, was dead, those who returned to the room couldn't manage any more than a suffocating silence.
PC Japanese (JP): 戻ってきた彼らは、真里亞の母である楼座の死を何と伝えればいいかわからず、息苦しく沈黙するしかできない。
Russian (RU): Не зная, какими словами объяснить Марии смерть её матери, Розы, возвратившиеся в комнату ничего не могли поделать с повисшим в ней удушающим молчанием.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ninguém sabia como explicar para Maria que sua mãe, Rosa, estava morta. Aqueles que voltaram para a sala não conseguiam mais suportar aquele silêncio sufocante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 回來後的他們，不知道該如何告訴真里亞她母親樓座的死訊，只好保持著令人窒息的沉默。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 回来后的他们，不知道该如何告诉真里亚她母亲楼座的死讯，只好保持着令人窒息的沉默。
Italian (IT): Facendo ritorno, non poterono fare altro che restare in un silenzio soffocante... incapaci di spiegare a Maria che sua madre Rosa fosse morta.
Turkish (TR): Maria'ya annesi Rosa'nın öldüğünü nasıl açıklayacaklarını bilemediklerinden, odaya geri dönenler kahredici bir sessizliğe bürünmekten öteye gidemediler.

Umineko Project (UP): At first, Maria returned their stares with a dubious look, but when she realized that they weren't trying to blame her for anything, she ignored them and again immersed herself in the television program...
Steam (ST): At first, Maria returned their stares with a dubious look, but when she realized they weren't trying to blame her for anything, she ignored them and again immersed herself in the TV program...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At first, Maria returned their stares with a dubious look, but when she realized that they weren't trying to blame her for anything, she ignored them and again immersed herself in the television program...
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞は最初、自分の顔をジロジロと見る彼らに怪訝な顔を返したが、自分を咎めているわけではないらしいと結論付けると、それらを無視して再びテレビに没頭するのだった…。
Russian (RU): Сначала Мария с подозрением взглянула на них, но, осознав, что её никто ни в чём не собирается обвинять, она отвернулась и снова углубилась в просмотр телевизионной передачи...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No início, Maria devolveu uma expressão dúbia aos olhares deles, mas quando ela percebeu que eles não estavam tentando culpá‐la por qualquer coisa, ela os ignorou e voltou a se concentrar novamente no programa de televisão...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然真里亞一開始還向盯著自己的他們還以詫異的神情，但在感覺到這並非是在責怪自己後，就不再去管他們，重新埋頭於了電視之中…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然真里亚一开始还向盯着自己的他们还以诧异的神情，但在感觉到这并非是在责怪自己后，就不再去管他们，重新埋头于了电视之中…。
Italian (IT): Inizialmente, Maria ricambiò i loro sguardi penetranti con un'espressione perplessa, ma quando concluse che non stavano cercando di incolparla di qualcosa, li ignorò, e si immerse nuovamente nel suo programma televisivo...
Turkish (TR): Maria ilk başta onların bakışlarına kuşkulu bir ifadeyle karşılık verdi, ama kendisini bir şey için suçlamaya çalışmadıklarını anladığında, onları görmezden geldi ve tekrar televizyon programına daldı...

Umineko Project (UP): The children wordlessly sat down on the sofa...{n}Their minds were probably blank from their state of shock.
Steam (ST): The children wordlessly sat down heavily on the sofa... Their minds were probably blank from their state of shock.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The children wordlessly sat down on the sofa... Their minds were probably blank from their state of shock.
PC Japanese (JP): 子どもたちは無言でソファーに深く腰をかける…。ショック状態で頭が真っ白になっているのだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 子どもたちは無言でソファーに深く腰をかける…。{n}ショック状態で頭が真っ白になっているのだろう。
Russian (RU): Не произнеся ни слова, дети присели на диван...{n}Из‐за перенесённого шока в их головах, должно быть, не было ни единой мысли.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As crianças, sem palavras, sentaram‐se no sofá...{n}Suas mentes provavelmente estavam em branco por conta do estado de choque.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 孩子們一言不發，深深地倒在沙發上…。{n}是因受打擊過度，大腦一片空白了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 孩子们一言不发，深深地倒在沙发上…。{n}是因受打击过度，大脑一片空白了吧。
Italian (IT): I ragazzi sprofondarono in silenzio sul divano... Probabilmente erano catatonici per via dello shock.
Turkish (TR): Çocuklar sessiz bir şekilde kanepeye oturdular...{n}Muhtemelen yaşadıkları şok nedeniyle zihinleri bomboştu.

Umineko Project (UP): Though they had all cried and mourned so much...now they just vaguely sat there, their faces expressionless...
Steam (ST): Everyone had already cried and mourned so much, ...but now they just vaguely sat there, their faces seeming to have lost all emotion...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Everyone had already cried and mourned so much...but now they just vaguely sat there, their faces expressionless...
PC Japanese (JP): みんなあれだけ泣き、悲しんだのに、…今は全ての感情を失ってしまったかのような表情で、ただぼんやりと座っている…。
Russian (RU): Совсем недавно они горько рыдали и скорбели... однако теперь они просто безмолвно сидели с отсутствующим выражением на лице...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Embora todos eles tivessem chorado e lamentado muito...agora eles estavam vagamente sentados ali, com seus rostos desprovidos de expressão...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 剛才大家還那麼悲痛地哭過、傷心過，…現在臉上卻像是失去了所有感情似的，只是呆呆地坐在那裡…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 刚才大家还那么悲痛地哭过、伤心过，…现在脸上却像是失去了所有感情似的，只是呆呆地坐在那里…。
Italian (IT): Sebbene avessero pianto e patito così tanto... in quel momento erano seduti con aria assente, e i loro volti sembravano aver perso ogni emozione...
Turkish (TR): Hepsi o kadar çok ağlamış ve yas tutmuş olmalarına rağmen...şimdi sadece öylece, yüzleri ifadesiz bir şekilde orada oturuyorlardı...

Umineko Project (UP): Only Kanon had returned to his usual calm expression.{n}...However, that probably didn't mean he had been able to wipe out the shock.
Steam (ST): Only Kanon had returned to his usual calm expression. ...However, that probably didn't mean he'd been able to wipe out the shock.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Only Kanon had returned to his usual calm expression. However, that probably didn't mean he had been able to wipe out the shock.
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音だけはいつものような落ち着いた表情に戻っていた。…しかし、だからといって、ショックが拭えたとは限らないだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 嘉音だけはいつものような落ち着いた表情に戻っていた。{n}…しかし、だからといって、ショックが拭えたとは限らないだろう。
Russian (RU): Лишь Канон смог вернуться в своё обычное спокойное состояние.{n}Однако это вовсе не значило, что он смог оправиться от шока.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apenas Kanon havia retornado à sua habitual expressão serena.{n}...Contudo, isso provavelmente não significava que ele tinha sido capaz de sair do choque.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只有嘉音恢復了往常的冷靜神情。{n}…可雖說如此，這也並不代表著那份打擊的影響已被拭去了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只有嘉音恢复了往常的冷静神情。{n}…可虽说如此，这也并不代表着那份打击的影响已被拭去了吧。
Italian (IT): Solo Kanon aveva riacquisito la sua solita compostezza... Tuttavia, ciò non voleva necessariamente dire che il suo trauma fosse svanito...
Turkish (TR): Sadece Kanon her zamanki sakin ifadesine geri dönmüştü.{n}...Ancak, bu muhtemelen yaşadığı şoku atlatabildiği anlamına gelmiyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Nothing was reflected in his eyes as he stared into the emptiness...
Steam (ST): ...Nothing was reflected in his eyes as he stared into empty space...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Nothing was reflected in his eyes as he stared into the emptiness...
PC Japanese (JP): …何もない虚空を睨み続けている彼の目には、今は何も映っていなかった…。
Russian (RU): В его глазах, глядящих в пустоту, не отражалось ничего...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Nada era refletido em seus olhos, enquanto ele encarava o vazio...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …他的眼睛盯著空無一物的虛空，裡面沒有映出任何事物…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …他的眼睛盯着空无一物的虚空，里面没有映出任何事物…。
Italian (IT): Il suo sguardo, che continuava a fissare il vuoto, era privo di qualsivoglia riflesso...
Turkish (TR): ...Boşluğa bakarken gözlerine hiçbir şey yansımıyordu...

Umineko Project (UP): Hideyoshi, fidgeting as he remembered that horrible scene, kept muttering. Unbelievable—That can't be somethin' of this world—It's the work of the devil.
Steam (ST): Hideyoshi kept on fidgeting, and every time he remembered that horrible scene, he started muttering about how he couldn't believe it, how it couldn't have been something from this world, how it must have been the work of demons.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Hideyoshi, fidgeting as he remembered that horrible scene, kept muttering, 'Unbelievable. That can't be somethin' of this world, it's the work of the devil.'
PC Japanese (JP): 秀吉はそわそわしながら、先ほどの惨状を思い出しては、信じられない、この世のものとは思えない、悪魔の仕業やと呟き続けている。
Russian (RU): Хидэёши, приходящий в волнение, стоило ему только вспомнить ту сцену, неустанно бормотал: "Невозможно", "Никто в мире до такого бы не додумался", "Это работа демонов".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Hideyoshi, inquieto, enquanto se lembrava daquela horrível cena, continuava murmurando. Inacreditável — isso não pode ser algo desse mundo — é obra do diabo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 秀吉顯得煩躁不安，他想起剛才的慘狀後，一直念叨著難以置信吶，想不到這世上還會有這樣的事吶，惡魔的所為吶等等。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 秀吉显得烦躁不安，他想起刚才的惨状后，一直念叨着难以置信呐，想不到这世上还会有这样的事呐，恶魔的所为呐等等。
Italian (IT): Hideyoshi era nervoso, e mentre rimembrava quello scenario raccapricciante, continuava a farfugliare di non poter crederci, che non poteva essere qualcosa accaduto realmente, e che dovesse essere opera del diavolo.
Turkish (TR): Hideyoshi, o korkunç sahneyi hatırladıkça kıpırdanıyor ve mırıldanmaya devam ediyordu. İnanılır gibi değil—Bu dünyaya ait bir şey olamaz—Bu şeytanın işi.

Umineko Project (UP): Every once in a while, he turned these into questions and bounced them off Nanjo, but Nanjo, in a calm doctorly manner, kept repeating that nothing could be understood by only glancing at the scene, and that until the police arrived, he wouldn't know anything.
Steam (ST): Every now and then, his mutterings produced a question directed at Nanjo, but the latter kept repeating in a calm, doctor-like manner that nothing could be understood by only glancing at the scene, and that until the police arrived, they wouldn't learn anything.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Every once in a while, he tried to ask a question and bumped into Nanjo, but Nanjo, in a calm doctor-like manner, kept repeating that nothing could be understood by only glancing at the scene, and that until the police arrived, he wouldn't know anything.
PC Japanese (JP): それらを時々、問い掛けの形に変えて南條にぶつけていたが、南條は医者らしく冷静に、少し見ただけでは何もわからない、警察が調べなければわからないと繰り返すのだった。
Russian (RU): Время от времени он пытался задать вопрос и обращался к Нанджо, но тот мягко, как и положено врачу, повторял, что ни о чём нельзя судить, просто посмотрев на сцену убийства, и что до прибытия полиции ему нечего сказать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De vez em quando, ele voltava para essas perguntas e as jogava sobre Nanjo.{n}Este porém, com o feitio calmo de um médico, continuava repetindo que nada podia ser compreendido apenas olhando a cena, e até que a polícia chegasse, ele não tinha como saber nada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 時而還把這些話換成問題的形式拋向南條，南條則以醫生的冷靜態度，重複著“只是略微看了一兩眼是搞不清楚的，必須讓警察來調查才能查清”的說辭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 时而还把这些话换成问题的形式抛向南条，南条则以医生的冷静态度，重复着“只是略微看了一两眼是搞不清楚的，必须让警察来调查才能查清”的说辞。
Italian (IT): Di tanto in tanto si rivolgeva a Nanjo, abbozzandogli qualche domanda, ma quest'ultimo, con la flemma tipica di un medico, gli ripeteva che non si poteva ricavare niente da una semplice occhiata, e che finché la polizia non avrebbe investigato, non si poteva sapere nulla.
Turkish (TR): Arada bir bunları sorulara dönüştürüp Nanjo'ya yöneltiyordu, ancak Nanjo sakin bir doktor edasıyla, olay yerine şöyle bir bakarak hiçbir şey anlaşılamayacağını, ve polis gelene kadar hiçbir şey bilemeyeceğini tekrarlayıp duruyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): However, Nanjo only appeared calm by comparison to Hideyoshi, who could not contain his agitation and fear.
Steam (ST): However, Nanjo only appeared calm next to Hideyoshi, who simply couldn't suppress his agitation and fear.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, Nanjo only appeared calm next to Hideyoshi, who was agitated and fearful to the utmost.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、南條が冷静に見えたのは、あくまでも興奮や恐怖が抑えられない秀吉に比べればというだけの話。
Russian (RU): Однако Нанджо лишь казался спокойным на фоне Хидэёши, который никак не мог совладать со своим волнением и чувством пережитого ужаса.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, Nanjo só parecia calmo em comparação com Hideyoshi, que não conseguia conter sua agitação e medo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，南條的冷靜，說到底也僅僅是和控制不住激動和恐懼的秀吉相比才顯得如此。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，南条的冷静，说到底也仅仅是和控制不住激动和恐惧的秀吉相比才显得如此。
Italian (IT): Tuttavia, Nanjo sembrava calmo solo se confrontato con Hideyoshi, il quale era completamente incapace di contenere il panico e l'agitazione.
Turkish (TR): Ancak Nanjo, telaşını ve korkusunu dizginleyemeyen Hideyoshi'ye kıyasla sakin görünüyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): In fact, Nanjo had also received a huge shock, and his face was deathly pale.
Steam (ST): In fact, Nanjo had also received a huge shock, and his face was a deathly pale.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In fact, Nanjo had also received a huge shock, his face a deathly pale.
PC Japanese (JP): 南條も実際は強いショックを受けていて、顔面は蒼白だった。
Russian (RU): На самом деле Нанджо был тоже крайне шокирован, и лицо его залила мертвенная бледность.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De fato, Nanjo também levou um enorme choque, e seu rosto estava realmente pálido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 南條實際上也受了很大的打擊，臉色蒼白。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 南条实际上也受了很大的打击，脸色苍白。
Italian (IT): In realtà, anche Nanjo aveva subito un enorme shock, ed era sbiancato in viso.
Turkish (TR): Aslında Nanjo da büyük bir şok geçirmişti ve yüzü ölümcül derecede solgundu.

Umineko Project (UP): Maybe it was because of their attitudes that Natsuhi tried to rise to the challenge and take control.
Steam (ST): Maybe that atmosphere was why she tried to rise to the challenge and take charge.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maybe it was because of their attitudes that Natsuhi tried to rise to the challenge and take control.
PC Japanese (JP): そんな中だからこそ、リーダーシップを発揮しようと奮い立つのだろうか。
Russian (RU): Возможно, именно всеобщий настрой побудил Нацухи принять вызов и взять ситуацию под свой контроль.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Provavelmente foi por conta de suas atitudes que a Natsuhi tentou aceitar o desafio e assumir o controle.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也許正因為是處於這種情況，夏妃才會想要奮發圖強地主持大局吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也许正因为是处于这种情况，夏妃才会想要奋发图强地主持大局吧。
Italian (IT): Forse fu proprio tale frangente a spingere Natsuhi a prendere il comando della situazione.
Turkish (TR): Belki de onların bu tavırları yüzünden Natsuhi kontrolü ele almaya çalıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi was apparently unchanged from her normal attitude.{n}And she briskly gave directions.
Steam (ST): Natsuhi appeared to be unchanged from her normal attitude. And she briskly gave directions.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi was apparently unchanged from her normal attitude. And she briskly gave directions.
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃は普段と変わらぬ態度のように見えた。そしてきびきびと指示をする。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 夏妃は普段と変わらぬ態度のように見えた。{n}そしてきびきびと指示をする。
Russian (RU): Поведение Нацухи не претерпело значительных изменений.{n}И она не мешкая раздавала указания.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Natsuhi, aparentemente, não tinha alterado sua atitude costumeira.{n}E rapidamente informou o que faria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她的神情舉止和平常沒什麼兩樣。{n}乾脆利落地下著指示。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她的神情举止和平常没什么两样。{n}干脆利落地下着指示。
Italian (IT): Natsuhi sembrò non essere mutata di atteggiamento. E diede prontamente delle istruzioni.
Turkish (TR): Natsuhi görünüşe göre normal tavrını değiştirmemişti.{n}Ve hızlıca talimatları verdi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): "......I will head to where Father is. ...Genji, quickly contact the police."
Steam (ST): "......I will go see Father. Genji, quickly contact the police."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Umineko Project (UP): "I wonder if you would allow me to tag along, Natsuhi nee‐san? ......Since Krauss nii‐san is now gone, the task of aiding Father has been left to me. It would be improper of me to relax here while relying entirely on you."
Steam (ST): "I wonder if you would allow me to tag along, Natsuhi nee-san? ......Since Krauss nii-san is now gone, the task of aiding Father has been left to me. It would be improper of me to relax here while relying entirely on you."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I wonder if you would allow me to tag along, Natsuhi nee-san? ......Since Krauss nii-san is now gone, the task of aiding Father has been left to me. It would be improper of me to relax here while relying entirely on Natsuhi nee-san."
PC Japanese (JP): 「私も一緒させていただいていいかしら、夏妃姉さん？　……蔵臼兄さんがいなくなった以上、お父様の補佐は私の仕事だもの。その私が夏妃姉さんに任せっきりでここでくつろいでるわけにはいかないわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私も一緒させていただいていいかしら、夏妃姉さん？　……蔵臼兄さんがいなくなった以上、お父様の補佐は私の仕事だもの。その私が夏妃姉さんに任せっきりでここでくつろいでるわけにはいかないわ」
Russian (RU): "Не позволишь ли мне пойти с тобой, Нацухи нээ‐сан? ......Поскольку Краусса нии‐сана больше нет, помогать отцу стало моей работой. Мне негоже будет прохлаждаться здесь, целиком положившись на тебя."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu me pergunto se você me deixaria acompanha‐lá, Natsuhi nee‐san? ......Já que o Krauss nii‐san se foi, a tarefa de ajudar o pai foi deixada para mim. Seria impróprio da minha parte relaxar aqui enquanto deixo tudo para você."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「可不可以讓我一起去啊，夏妃姐姐？……既然藏臼哥已經不在了，那輔佐爸就是我的工作了。我可不能全推在夏妃姐姐身上，只顧自己在這兒休息。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「可不可以让我一起去啊，夏妃姐姐？……既然藏臼哥已经不在了，那辅佐爸就是我的工作了。我可不能全推在夏妃姐姐身上，只顾自己在这儿休息。」
Italian (IT): "Per caso potrei accompagnarti, Natsuhi-san...? Dato che il fratellone Klaus non c'è più, è mio compito assistere nostro padre. Non posso prendermela comoda e lasciare tutto a te."
Turkish (TR): "Acaba benim de peşine takılmama izin verir misin, Natsuhi nee-san? ......Krauss nii-san gittiğine göre babama yardım etme görevi bana kaldı. Tamamen sana güvenerek burada dinlenmem uygunsuz olur."

Umineko Project (UP): Natsuhi was struck speechless by Eva's aggressive actions in a situation like this.
Steam (ST): Natsuhi was struck speechless by Eva's aggressive move in a situation like this.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): このような事態に何と逞しいことかと、夏妃は絶句する。
Russian (RU): Нацухи просто поразили агрессивные действия Евы в подобной ситуации.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Natsuhi foi atingida e ficou sem palavras pelas ações agressivas de Eva em um momento como aquele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 都這種情況了還在逞什麼強，夏妃無話可說。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 都这种情况了还在逞什么强，夏妃无话可说。

Umineko Project (UP): It seemed that she was claiming that, with Krauss dead, the one to take responsibility should not be his wife, but herself, the next highly ranked in the family.
Steam (ST): She seemed to be claiming that, with Krauss dead, the one to take responsibility shouldn't be his wife, but herself, the next highly ranked in the family.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seemed that she was claiming that, with Krauss dead, the one to take responsibility should not be his wife, but herself, the next highly ranked in the family.
PC Japanese (JP): 蔵臼が死んだなら、次に指揮を執るのはその妻ではなく、次の序列である自分だと、そう主張したいらしい。
Russian (RU): Из её слов следовало, что со смертью Краусса взять на себя его обязанности и ответственность должна не его жена, а именно Ева, как следующий по статусу человек в семейной иерархии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que ela estava afirmando que, com a morte de Krauss, a pessoa a carregar a responsabilidade não deveria ser a esposa, mas ela mesma, a próxima no topo do ranking da família.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 似乎繪羽是想主張藏臼死後，手握領導權的不該是他的妻子，而是排在藏臼序列之後的自己。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 似乎绘羽是想主张藏臼死后，手握领导权的不该是他的妻子，而是排在藏臼序列之后的自己。
Italian (IT): Sembrava affermare che, con la morte di Klaus, quella che avrebbe dovuto prendere le redini non sarebbe dovuta essere sua moglie, ma lei stessa, la successiva nella gerarchia...
Turkish (TR): Görünüşe göre, Krauss öldüğüne göre, sorumluluğu alması gereken kişinin onun karısı değil, ailede bir sonraki yüksek rütbeli kişi olan kendisi olması gerektiğini iddia ediyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Possibly, she was not happy that Natsuhi was ignoring her and handling matters herself in this extreme situation.
Steam (ST): ...Or maybe she hadn't been at all happy when Natsuhi took command without reference to her in such an extreme situation.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Possibly, she had not been happy at all when Natsuhi had ignored her in this extreme situation.
PC Japanese (JP): …あるいは、この非常事態に夏妃が自分を差し置いて切り盛りしているのが気に入らないのか。
Russian (RU): ...По‐видимому, её совсем не радовало, что в такой напряжённой ситуации Нацухи не обратила на неё никакого внимания.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Possivelmente, ela não estava feliz com Natsuhi a ignorando e encarregando‐se dos assuntos nesta situação extrema.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …又或者，她是不爽夏妃在這種非常情況下越過自己發號施令嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): …又或者，她是不爽夏妃在这种非常情况下越过自己发号施令吗？
Italian (IT): O forse non gradì che Natsuhi avesse gestito quella situazione di emergenza senza considerarla.
Turkish (TR): ...Belki de, Natsuhi'nin kendisini görmezden gelmesinden ve bu olağanüstü durumda meseleleri kendi başına halletmeye çalışmasından memnun değildi.

Umineko Project (UP): Since she wasn't the kind of person to run around, it would be normal to sense that something had happened, ...but since everyone had been stricken by that earlier shock, none of them took any notice of this trivial difference.
Steam (ST): She usually wasn't the kind of person to run around, so under normal conditions, most people would have taken her entrance as sign that something was the matter, ...but because everyone was still stricken with shock, they hardly even noticed her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Since she normally wasn't the kind of person to run around, anyone would guess that something had happened, ...but since everyone had been stricken by that earlier shock, this level of a disturbance didn't overly trouble them.
PC Japanese (JP): 普段は走るような人ではないので、何かあったのかと思うのが正常な感覚だが、…今は誰もがショックに打ちひしがれていて、その程度のことを気には留めなかった。
Russian (RU): Поскольку она не походила на человека, склонного к беготне, этот поступок явно свидетельствовал о том, что что‐то произошло...... но поскольку все до сих пор не успели отойти от предыдущего шока, то причина её волнения их не особенно обеспокоила.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como ela não era o tipo de pessoa que costuma correr, seria normal pensar que algo tinha acontecido, ...mas, desde que todos haviam sidos atingidos pelo choque anterior, nenhum deles se deu conta dessa diferença trivial.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她平時不是個會跑來跑去的人，因此正常來想就知道一定是出了什麼事，…但現在無論是誰，都被突如其來的事件打垮了精神，不會對這麼點小事有所在意了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她平时不是个会跑来跑去的人，因此正常来想就知道一定是出了什么事，…但现在无论是谁，都被突如其来的事件打垮了精神，不会对这么点小事有所在意了。
Italian (IT): Visto che di solito non era il tipo di persona che andava di fretta, sarebbe stato normale pensare che fosse successo qualcosa... ma tutti erano distrutti dallo shock, e nessuno vi prestò particolare attenzione.
Turkish (TR): Etrafta koşuşturacak biri olmadığından, bir terslik olduğunun anlaşılabilmesi normal olabilirdi, ...ancak herkes daha önceki şokun etkisinde olduğundan, hiçbiri bu önemsiz farklılığa dikkat etmedi.

Umineko Project (UP): The first to start running was George.{n}His harsh footsteps jogged Hideyoshi and Nanjo to their senses, and they chased after him. Battler and the others followed.
Steam (ST): The first one to start running was George. His harsh footsteps jogged Hideyoshi and Nanjo to their senses, and they chased after him. Battler and the others followed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): George ran straight for it. His harsh footsteps jogged Hideyoshi and Nanjo to their senses, and they chased after him. Battler and the others followed.
PC Japanese (JP): 真っ先に走ったのは譲治だった。その荒々しい足音に我に帰った秀吉と南條が後を追う。戦人たちもそれに続く。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 真っ先に走ったのは譲治だった。{n}その荒々しい足音に我に返った秀吉と南條が後を追う。戦人たちもそれに続く。
Russian (RU): Джордж первым сорвался с места.{n}Резкие звуки его бегущих шагов привели Хидэёши и Нанджо в чувство, и они бросились за ним. Баттлер и остальные побежали вслед за ними.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O primeiro que começou a correr foi George.{n}Seus passos ásperos ativaram os sentidos de Hideyoshi e Nanjo, fazendo com que fossem atrás dele. Battler e os outros foram em seguida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 最先跑出去的是讓治。{n}因這粗暴的腳步聲回過神來的秀吉和南條緊隨其後。戰人他們也跟在了後面。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 最先跑出去的是让治。{n}因这粗暴的脚步声回过神来的秀吉和南条紧随其后。战人他们也跟在了后面。
Italian (IT): George fu il primo a scattare. Il rumore impetuoso dei suoi passi fece rinsavire Hideyoshi e Nanjo, i quali gli corsero dietro. Battler e gli altri li seguirono.
Turkish (TR): İlk koşmaya başlayan George oldu.{n}Onun şiddetli ayak sesleri Hideyoshi ve Nanjo'nun aklını başına getirdi ve peşinden koştular. Battler ve diğerleri de onu takip etti.

Umineko Project (UP): They flew into the dining hall one after another, but they didn't find any change that would have caused Kumasawa to go pale.
Steam (ST): They flew into the dining hall one after another, but they didn't find any change that might have caused Kumasawa to go pale.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They flew into the dining hall one after another, but they didn't find any change that would have caused Kumasawa to go pale.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼らは次々に食堂に飛び込むが、熊沢が真っ青になるほどの変化は見つけられなかった。
Russian (RU): Один за другим они ворвались в обеденный зал, но не обнаружили каких‐либо изменений, которые могли бы заставить Кумасаву‐сан так побледнеть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles correram para a sala de jantar um após o outro, porém eles não encontraram nada que pudesse explicar a palidez de Kumasawa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然眾人一個接一個地飛奔進了餐廳，但並沒有發現什麼能讓熊澤嚇得臉發青的變化。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然众人一个接一个地飞奔进了餐厅，但并没有发现什么能让熊泽吓得脸发青的变化。
Italian (IT): Uno dopo l'altro, si fiondarono nella sala da pranzo, ma non trovarono alcun cambiamento che potesse aver fatto sbiancare Kumasawa...
Turkish (TR): Birbiri ardına yemek salonuna girdiler ama Kumasawa'nın solgunlaşmasına neden olacak herhangi bir değişiklik fark edemediler.

Umineko Project (UP): ...To those who had viewed that gruesome scene in the storehouse, it was a bit of an anticlimax.
Steam (ST): ...To those who had viewed that gruesome scene in the storehouse, it was a bit of an anticlimax.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …あの倉庫の凄惨さを知る者たちにとって、それは一瞬、拍子抜けだった。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Para aqueles que haviam visto aquela cena grotesca no depósito, acabou sendo um pouco anticlimático.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …這讓他們這些知道剛才倉庫裡淒慘狀況的人，瞬間有些泄氣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …这让他们这些知道刚才仓库里凄惨状况的人，瞬间有些泄气。
Italian (IT): Per un attimo, chi aveva assitito all'orrore avvenuto nel magazzino si sentì preso in giro.
Turkish (TR): ...Ambardaki o korkunç sahneyi görenler için bu biraz hayal kırıklığıydı.

Umineko Project (UP): However, Kumasawa, who had followed them, pointed it out.{n}......There really were some traces of blood on the floor.
Steam (ST): However, Kumasawa, who had followed them, pointed it out. ......There really were some traces of blood remaining on the floor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, Kumasawa, who had followed them, pointed it out.......There really were some traces of blood remaining on the floor.
PC Japanese (JP): だが、後から来た熊沢が指差して教えてくれた。……確かに、床に血の跡が残っていたのである。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): だが、後から来た熊沢が指差して教えてくれた。{n}……確かに、床に血の跡が残っていたのである。
Russian (RU): Однако Кумасава, которая последовала за ними, указала им на место.{n}......В том месте на полу действительно имелись следы крови.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Contudo, Kumasawa, que tinha seguido atrás deles, apontou.{n}......Havia somente alguns vestígios de sangue no chão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，隨後跟來的熊澤為他們指出了變化所在。{n}……確實，地板上殘留著血跡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，随后跟来的熊泽为他们指出了变化所在。{n}……确实，地板上残留着血迹。
Italian (IT): Ma Kumasawa, che li raggiunse poco dopo, indicò loro qualcosa... In effetti, erano rimaste delle tracce di sangue sul pavimento...
Turkish (TR): Ancak, peşlerinden gelen Kumasawa yere işaret çekti.{n}......Yerde gerçekten de bazı kan izleri vardı.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Compared to that terrible scene, it was not very dramatic.{n}...However, if you calmly thought about it, this definitely indicated the loss of a lot of blood.
Steam (ST): ...Compared to that terrible scene, it wasn't very impressive. ...However, if you calmly thought about it, this definitely indicated the loss of a lot of blood.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Compared to that terrible scene, it was not very impressive....However, if you calmly thought about it, this definitely indicated the loss of a lot of blood.
PC Japanese (JP): …あの惨状を思えばそれは決して派手ではない。…しかし冷静に考えたなら、これは相当の出血を物語るのに間違いなかった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …あの惨状を思えばそれは決して派手ではない。{n}…しかし冷静に考えたなら、これは相当の出血を物語るのに間違いなかった。
Russian (RU): ...В сравнении с той ужасной сценой это было не столь впечатляюще.{n}...Однако, если спокойно подумать об этом, то, судя по количеству крови, её тут было потеряно изрядно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Em comparação com aquela terrível cena, isso não era muito dramático.{n}...Contudo, se você pensar calmamente a respeito, isso indicava a perda de muito sangue.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …回想起剛才那慘狀，這絕對不算什麼大不了的。{n}…但是冷靜一想，這無疑是在說明，有人在這裡流了相當多的血。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …回想起刚才那惨状，这绝对不算什么大不了的。{n}…但是冷静一想，这无疑是在说明，有人在这里流了相当多的血。
Italian (IT): Non erano affatto stupefacenti, se messe a paragone con quell'altra visione immonda... Tuttavia, se ci si pensava su lucidamente, indicavano senza dubbio un'enorme perdita di sangue.
Turkish (TR): ...O korkunç sahneye kıyasla, çok dramatik değildi.{n}...Ancak, sakin bir şekilde düşünecek olursanız, bu kesinlikle çok fazla kan kaybına işaret ediyordu.

Russian (RU): "............Миледи. Вам не стоит оставаться здесь ни минутой больше. ...Давайте вернёмся в гостиную."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Ojou‐sama. Não seria bom permanecer aqui por mais tempo. ...Vamos voltar para a sala de visitas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………小姐。再在這裡待下去對您不好。…請回客廳吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………小姐。再在这里待下去对您不好。…请回客厅吧。」
Italian (IT): "...Signorina. Restare qui non le farà bene... Torniamo al salotto."
Turkish (TR): "............Leydim. Burada daha fazla kalmanız iyi olmaz. ...Hadi salona dönelim."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "I agree... .........Uncle Hideyoshi! I think this room will be really important to the police. Don't you think it would be bad if we trampled all over it?"
Steam (ST): "I agree... ......Uncle Hideyoshi! I think this room'll be really important to the police. Don't you think it'd be bad if we trampled all over it?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I agree............Hideyoshi oji-san! I think this room will be really important to the police. Don't you think it would be bad if we trampled all over it?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「俺も同感さ…。………秀吉伯父さん！　この部屋は多分、警察にとって重要な意味があると思います。俺たちが踏み荒らしちまうのはマズイじゃないんすか？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「俺も同感さ…。………秀吉伯父さん！　この部屋は多分、警察にとって重要な意味があると思います。俺たちが踏み荒らしちまうのはマズイんじゃないんすか？」
Russian (RU): "Я согласен... .........Дядя Хидэёши! Я думаю, что эта комната будет иметь важное значение для полиции. Тебе не кажется, что мы усложним им задачу, если всё тут затопчем?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu concordo... .........Tio Hideyoshi! Eu acho que esta sala será muito importante para a polícia. Vocês não acham que seria ruim se nós deixássemos pegadas por toda a parte?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我也有同感…。………秀吉姑父！我覺得這房間對警察來說，多半是有重要意義的。我們在這兒亂走的話不太好吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我也有同感…。………秀吉姑父！我觉得这房间对警察来说，多半是有重要意义的。我们在这儿乱走的话不太好吧？」
Italian (IT): "Concordo... Zio Hideyoshi! Credo che questa stanza sarà molto importante per la polizia. Non pensi che sarebbe un problema se calpestassimo in giro?"
Turkish (TR): "Katılıyorum... .........Hideyoshi Amca! Sanırım bu oda polis için çok önemli olacak. Her tarafında gezmemiz sizce de kötü olmaz mı?"

Umineko Project (UP): Battler proposed this in a slightly powerful voice as, together with Kanon, he grabbed the pale and shaking Jessica's shoulders.
Steam (ST): Battler proposed this in a slightly firm voice as, along with Kanon, he grabbed the pale and shaking Jessica's shoulders.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Battler proposed this in a slightly powerful voice as, along with Kanon, he grabbed the pale and shaking Jessica's shoulders.
PC Japanese (JP): 真っ青になって震える朱志香の肩を、嘉音と共に抱き、戦人は少しだけ力強い声で提案する。
Russian (RU): Баттлер выдвинул это предложение, добавив немного твёрдости в голос, одновременно поддерживая бледную и дрожащую Джессику вместе с Каноном.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Battler propôs isso com uma voz levemente veemente, junto com Kanon, que agarrou e sacudiu os ombros da pálida Jessica.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 與嘉音一同摟住臉色發青、不住顫抖的朱志香後，戰人用略微有力的聲音提出了自己的意見。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 与嘉音一同搂住脸色发青、不住颤抖的朱志香后，战人用略微有力的声音提出了自己的意见。
Italian (IT): Propose Battler con un tono leggermente perentorio, mentre insieme a Kanon, teneva le spalle di Jessica, pallida e tremante.
Turkish (TR): Battler, Kanon'la birlikte Jessica'nın solgun ve titreyen omuzlarını tutarken biraz güçlü bir sesle bunu söyledi.

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Everything is just as Battler‐san has said. There is nothing more to be gained from remaining in this room."
Steam (ST): "......Everything is just as Battler-san has said. There is nothing more to be gained from remaining in this room."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Everything is just as Battler-san has said. There is nothing more to be gained from remaining in this room."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………戦人さんの言う通りですな。この部屋にこれ以上、好んで居続けることはありますまい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………戦人さんの言う通りですな。この部屋にこれ以上、好んで居続けることはありますまい」
Russian (RU): ".........Нам следует прислушаться к словам Баттлера‐сана. Мы сейчас вряд ли что‐нибудь выиграем от дальнейшего пребывания в этой комнате."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........É exatamente como o Battler‐san disse. Não há mais nada a ganhar permanecendo aqui."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………戰人說得對。不可以再隨便待在這房間裡了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………战人说得对。不可以再随便待在这房间里了。」
Italian (IT): "...È come dice Battler-san. Non otterremo nulla rimanendo in questa stanza."
Turkish (TR): ".........Her şey Battler-san'ın söylediği gibi. Bu odada kalarak elde edilecek başka bir şey yok."

Umineko Project (UP): Nanjo spoke while looking at the pale faces all around.
Steam (ST): Nanjo spoke while looking at everyone's pale faces.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Nanjo spoke while looking at everyone's pale faces.
PC Japanese (JP): 南條が全員の蒼白な顔を見て言う。
Russian (RU): Так сказал Нанджо, глядя в бледные лица окружающих.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nanjo falou enquanto olhava o rosto pálido de todos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 南條看著眾人蒼白的臉說道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 南条看着众人苍白的脸说道。
Italian (IT): Disse Nanjo, guardando i visi biancastri dei presenti...
Turkish (TR): Nanjo etraftaki solgun yüzlere bakarken konuştu.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Even though that horrible scene in the storehouse had felt like something not of this world, at least it was in a place far from here, a place we had been able to cut ourselves off and run away from, which had helped everyone to keep on going.
Steam (ST): ......Even though that horrible scene in the storehouse felt like something not of this world, at least then we'd been able to leave, to cut ourselves off from that place and run away. Everyone had shared in that feeling.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Even though that horrible scene in the storehouse had felt like something not of this world, at least then we had been able to leave, to cut ourselves off from that place and run away. Everyone had shared in that feeling.
PC Japanese (JP): ……あの倉庫の惨状は、この世のものとは思えないものではあっても、少なくともこことは離れた場所で、切り離して逃げてきたという気持ちで誰もが自分を納得させていた。
Russian (RU): ......Хотя та ужасная сцена в кладовой создавала полное ощущение нереальности происходящего, в том случае мы были далеко отсюда, у нас по крайней мере была возможность уйти, отгородиться от того места и убежать. Все разделяли это чувство.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mesmo que a cena horrível no depósito não parecesse ser algo deste mundo, pelo menos até agora estávamos distantes daquele lugar, um lugar do qual nós tínhamos sido capazes de nos manter afastados, o que havia ajudado todos a continuar em frente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……即便倉庫的慘狀，根本無法想像是這個世上會有的，但那至少是在離此處有些距離的地方，無論是誰都已經抱著早已遠離那裡的心情，說服自己安下了心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……即便仓库的惨状，根本无法想象是这个世上会有的，但那至少是在离此处有些距离的地方，无论是谁都已经抱着早已远离那里的心情，说服自己安下了心。
Italian (IT): Anche se quell'orribile scena nel magazzino non sembrava essere reale, perlomeno tutti condivisero il desiderio di andarsene, e di lasciare alle spalle quel luogo separato da tutto e da tutti...
Turkish (TR): ......Ambardaki o korkunç sahne bu dünyadan değilmiş gibi hissettirmiş olsa da, en azından buradan uzakta ve kendimizi oradan uzaklaştırıp kaçabildiğimiz bir yerdeydi ve bu da herkesin ilerleyebilmesine yardımcı olmuştu.

Umineko Project (UP): ......However, this dining hall was different.
Steam (ST): ......However, this dining hall was different.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……でもこの食堂は違う。
Russian (RU): ......Однако с обеденным залом было иначе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Porém, com a sala de jantar era diferente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……但是這餐廳可不一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但是这餐厅可不一样。
Italian (IT): Ma questa sala da pranzo era diversa.
Turkish (TR): ......Ancak bu yemek salonu farklıydı.

Umineko Project (UP): It was in the mansion's main wing, ...and as Jessica had said, it was supposed to be one of the more relaxing places within the mansion. It was the same place where all of the relatives had enjoyed lunch and dinner yesterday.
Steam (ST): It was in the mansion, the main building on this estate, ...and as Jessica had said, it should have been one of the most calming places even inside the mansion. It was where all of the relatives had eaten lunch and dinner yesterday.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was in the main wing of the mansion, ...and as Jessica had said, the inside of the mansion was supposed to be the one place where we could feel secure. It was the same place that all of the relatives had eaten lunch and dinner yesterday.
PC Japanese (JP): 母屋である屋敷の中にあり、…そして朱志香の言う通り、この屋敷の中でも心落ち着く場所のひとつだったはずだ。昨日、親類みんなでランチやディナーを楽しんだ場所だ。
Russian (RU): Это было основное крыло особняка и...... как сказала Джессика, внутреннее пространство особняка было единственным местом, где мы могли чувствовать себя в безопасности. Это было то самое место, где вчера все родственники вкушали обед и ужин.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela ficava na ala principal da mansão, ...e, como a Jessica havia dito, era suposto ser um dos lugares mais tranquilos dentro da mansão. Era o mesmo lugar onde todos os parentes haviam desfrutado do almoço e jantar recentemente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它位於作為主屋的大屋之中，…並且就如朱志香所說，即便是在這大屋之中，它也本應是個能放鬆心情的場所之一。也是昨天，親戚們共同享受午餐與晚餐的場所。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它位于作为主屋的大屋之中，…并且就如朱志香所说，即便是在这大屋之中，它也本应是个能放松心情的场所之一。也是昨天，亲戚们共同享受午餐与晚餐的场所。
Italian (IT): Era nella villa, l'edificio principale della tenuta... e come aveva detto Jessica, avrebbe dovuto essere uno dei luoghi più tranquilli della residenza. Era lo stesso posto in cui ieri, tutti i parenti avevano gustato pranzo e cena...
Turkish (TR): Malikanenin ana kanadındaydı, ...ve Jessica'nın da söylediği gibi, malikanenin en rahatlatıcı yerlerinden biri olması gerekiyordu. Burası dün tüm akrabaların öğle ve akşam yemeklerini yedikleri yerle aynı yerdi.

Umineko Project (UP): ......The shock of seeing this place smeared with blood reminded us of that horrible spectacle in the storehouse, and forced us to accept that we really hadn't been able to run away from the scene of that tragedy......
Steam (ST): ......The shock of seeing this place smeared with blood reminded us of that horrible spectacle in the storehouse... and forced us to accept that we hadn't really been able to run away from the scene of that tragedy......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……そこが、血で汚されていることの衝撃は、倉庫の惨状を再び思い出させ、自分たちが決して惨劇現場から逃れてはいないことを無理やり認識させるのだ……。
Russian (RU): ......Шок от увиденной в этом месте крови напомнил нам о том ужасном зрелище в кладовой, вынуждая нас признать, что в действительности мы не смогли убежать от сцены той трагедии......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O choque de ver este lugar manchado de sangue nos lembrou do espetáculo no depósito, e nos forçou a aceitar que realmente não tínhamos sido capazes de fugir da cena daquela tragédia......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而這裡卻被染上了血污。這個衝擊性的事實，使眾人再次想起了倉庫裡的慘狀，硬是讓大家認識到，自己絕對沒有從慘劇的現場逃出來……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而这里却被染上了血污。这个冲击性的事实，使众人再次想起了仓库里的惨状，硬是让大家认识到，自己绝对没有从惨剧的现场逃出来……。
Italian (IT): L'impatto nel vedere quel luogo imbrattato di sangue, risvegliò i ricordi di quella macabra visione nel magazzino... e li costrinse ad accettare il fatto che non fossero mai riusciti a superare la scena di quella tragedia...
Turkish (TR): ......Bu yerin kana bulanmış olduğunu görmenin şoku bize ambardaki o korkunç manzarayı hatırlattı, ve bizi o trajedinin yaşandığı yerden gerçekten kaçamadığımızı kabul etmeye zorladı......

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Umineko Project (UP): "...Yeah. I agree too... The killer might have left traces in this room!"
Steam (ST): "...Hmm. I agree too... The culprit might've left traces in this room!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Hmm. I also agree... The culprit might have left traces in this room!
PC Japanese (JP): 「…うむ。わしも同感や…。この部屋には犯人の痕跡が残ってるかもわからんしな！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…うむ。わしも同感や…。この部屋には犯人の痕跡が残ってるかもわからんしな！」
Russian (RU): "...Хм‐м. Я тоже согласен... Преступник мог оставить следы в этой комнате!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Sim. Eu também concordo... O assassino pode ter deixado vestígios nesta sala!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…嗯。俺也有同感吶…。說不定這房間裡還留著犯人的蜘絲馬跡吶！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…嗯。俺也有同感呐…。说不定这房间里还留着犯人的蜘丝马迹呐！」
Italian (IT): "...Mmh. Anch'io sono d'accordo... Il colpevole potrebbe aver lasciato delle tracce in questa stanza!"
Turkish (TR): "...Evet. Ben de katılıyorum... Katil bu odada bir iz bırakmış olabilir!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Umineko Project (UP): "Amateurs like us shouldn't stir the place up. ...Let's leave quick. Come on, come on!"
Steam (ST): Amateurs like us shouldn't stir the place up. ...Let's leave quickly. Quickly, quickly!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Amateurs like us shouldn't stir the place up. ...Let's leave quickly. Quickly, quickly!"
PC Japanese (JP): 素人のわしらがかき回すべきとちゃうで。…早ぅ出るんや。早う早ぅ！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「素人のわしらがかき回すべきとちゃうで。…早ぅ出るんや。早う早ぅ！」
Russian (RU): "Непрофессионалы вроде нас не должны здесь находиться. ...Давайте поскорее оставим помещение. Давайте, давайте!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Amadores como nós não deveriam mexer no local. ...Vamos sair depressa. Vamos, vamos!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「俺們外行人不該在這兒搗漿糊吶。…得趕快出去。快點快點！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「俺们外行人不该在这儿捣浆糊呐。…得赶快出去。快点快点！」
Italian (IT): "Gli inesperti come noi non dovrebbero frugare in giro... Andiamo via subito. Presto, presto!"
Turkish (TR): "Bizim gibi amatörler ortalığı birbirine katmamalı. ...Çabucak çıkalım. Hadi, hadi!"

Umineko Project (UP): Hideyoshi also understood the meaning of what Battler had said, and pushed everyone to hurry out of the dining hall.
Steam (ST): Hideyoshi also understood the meaning of what Battler had said...and pushed everyone to hurry out of the dining hall.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 秀吉も戦人の言う意味を理解し、急き立てるように食堂から出ろ出ろと叫ぶ。
Russian (RU): Хидэёши тоже понял смысл сказанного Баттлером и поэтому поспешил вывести всех из обеденного зала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Hideyoshi também entendeu o significado do que Battler tinha dito, e empurrou todos rapidamente para fora da sala de jantar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 秀吉也理解了戰人話裡的意思，像是催促似的喊著讓大家快從餐廳出去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 秀吉也理解了战人话里的意思，像是催促似的喊着让大家快从餐厅出去。
Italian (IT): Anche Hideyoshi comprese il significato delle parole di Battler... e urlò di lasciare la sala da pranzo al più presto...
Turkish (TR): Hideyoshi de Battler'ın söylediklerinin ne anlama geldiğini anladı ve herkesi aceleyle yemek salonundan çıkmaları için itti.

Umineko Project (UP): ...The way we were then, looking at that blood any longer would have been too harsh.
Steam (ST): ...The way we were then, looking at that blood any longer would've been too harsh.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …これ以上、血を見るのは今の自分たちには酷に過ぎることなのだ。
Russian (RU): ...Учитывая, в каком состоянии мы все пребывали, смотреть на кровь ещё было для нас сущей пыткой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Olhar aquele sangue por mais algum tempo teria sido muito cruel.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …再繼續盯著這灘血，對於現在的每個人而言，都太過殘酷了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …再继续盯着这滩血，对于现在的每个人而言，都太过残酷了。
Italian (IT): Nello stato in cui erano al momento, guardare quel sangue ancora a lungo sarebbe stato fin troppo eccessivo.
Turkish (TR): ...O anki halimizle, o kana daha fazla bakmak çok ağır olurdu.

Umineko Project (UP): Nobody went against his words. Everyone raced each other out of the dining hall. ............Almost as though the last person in the room would be trapped in there, all alone...
Steam (ST): Nobody went against his words. Everyone raced each other out of the dining hall. ......It was almost as though the last person in the room would be trapped in there, all alone.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Nobody went against his words. Everyone raced each other out of the dining hall.............It was almost as though the last person in the room would be trapped in there, all alone.
PC Japanese (JP): その言葉に逆らう者はいなかった。皆、先を争うように食堂を後にする。…………まるで、最後の人はこの部屋に取り残されて閉じ込められてしまうかのように…。
Russian (RU): Никто не возразил против его слов. Поторапливая друг друга, все один за другим покинули комнату. ............Казалось, если кто‐нибудь ещё задержится в этой комнате, то окажется в ловушке.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ninguém foi contra suas palavras. Todos correram ao mesmo tempo para fora da sala de jantar. ...Quase parecendo que a última pessoa que permanecesse na sala ficaria presa ali, sozinha...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 誰都沒有反抗這句話。大家都爭先恐後地離開餐廳。…………簡直就像，走在最後的人會被留在這房間裡關起來似的…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 谁都没有反抗这句话。大家都争先恐后地离开餐厅。…………简直就像，走在最后的人会被留在这房间里关起来似的…。
Italian (IT): Nessuno protestò. Tutti uscirono dalla sala da pranzo, come se stessero facendo a gara tra loro... Era come se l'ultima persona rimasta nella stanza sarebbe finita intrappolata lì dentro.
Turkish (TR): Kimse onun sözlerine karşı çıkmadı. Herkes yemek salonundan çıkmak için birbiriyle yarıştı. ............Tıpkı kalacak olan son kişi orada tek başına kapana kısılacakmış gibi...

Umineko Project (UP): Once in the hallway, we lent a shoulder to Kumasawa, who was leaning against the wall still trembling, and we all headed back to the parlor together.
Steam (ST): Once in the hallway, we lent a hand to Kumasawa, who was still trembling and leaning against the wall, and we all headed back to the parlor together.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Once in the hallway, we helped Kumasawa, who was still trembling and leaning against the wall, and we all headed back to the parlor together.
PC Japanese (JP): 廊下で、未だ震えて壁にもたれかかる熊沢に肩を貸すと、一同は客間に戻ってきた。
Russian (RU): Выйдя в коридор, мы поддержали Кумасаву, всё ещё дрожавшую и опирающуюся о стену, и все вместе вернулись в гостиную.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma vez na entrada, nós emprestamos um ombro à Kumasawa, que estava encostada tremendo na parede, e todos voltamos juntos para a sala de visitas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 扶起靠在走廊牆壁上，仍在哆嗦著的熊澤後，一行人回到了客廳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 扶起靠在走廊墙壁上，仍在哆嗦着的熊泽后，一行人回到了客厅。
Italian (IT): Una volta nel corridoio, aiutarono Kumasawa, appoggiatasi al muro e ancora tremante, e tornarono insieme nel salotto...
Turkish (TR): Koridora çıktıktan sonra, duvara yaslanmış titreyen Kumasawa'ya destek olduk ve hep birlikte salona geri döndük.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Then, Genji returned.
Steam (ST): ...Then, Genji returned.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …そこへ源次が戻ってくる。
Russian (RU): ...Затем вернулся Генджи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Então, Genji retornou.
