Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...If I tried 'turning the chessboard over' like I had learned from Kyrie-san, that was exactly why it was impossible for a servant to be the culprit.
PC Japanese (JP): …霧江さんに習った“チェス盤をひっくり返して”の考え方だと、……だからこそ、使用人が犯人ということはありえないと思うのだ。
Russian (RU): ...Если развернуть шахматную доску, как учила меня Кирие‐сан......... то слуги просто не могли быть преступниками.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Se eu tentasse "virar o tabuleiro", como eu tinha aprendido com a Kyrie‐san, ......era exatamente por isso que era impossível que os serviçais fossem os culpados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …我覺得，如果依照從霧江姐那裡學來的“把國際象棋盤翻轉過來”思維法，……那正因為如此，傭人們才不可能是犯人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …我觉得，如果依照从雾江姐那里学来的“把国际象棋盘翻转过来”思维法，……那正因为如此，佣人们才不可能是犯人。
Italian (IT): Applicare la mentalità del ‘rigirare la scacchiera’ che avevo appreso da Kirie-san...era l'esatta ragione per cui ritenevo impossibile che un domestico fosse il colpevole.
Turkish (TR): ...Kyrie-san'dan öğrendiğim gibi "satranç tahtasını ters çevirmeyi" deneseydim, ......işte tam da bu yüzden hizmetkârların suçlu olması imkansızdı.

Umineko Project (UP): If the servants really had been the culprits, they wouldn't have hidden the bodies in a place that was tied to themselves.
Steam (ST): If the servants really were the culprits, they wouldn't hide the bodies in a place connected to themselves.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If the servants really had been the culprits, they wouldn't hide the bodies in a place that was tied to themselves.
PC Japanese (JP): 本当に使用人たちが犯人なら、自分たちの縁のある場所には遺体を隠さない。
Russian (RU): Будь слуги на самом деле преступниками, они бы не стали прятать тела в месте, как‐то относящемся к ним.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se os serviçais realmente fossem os culpados, eles não teriam escondido os corpos em um lugar que está ligado a eles mesmo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果傭人們真是犯人，他們是不會把遺體藏在和自己有關係的地方的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果佣人们真是犯人，他们是不会把遗体藏在和自己有关系的地方的。
Italian (IT): Se i domestici fossero stati davvero i colpevoli, non avrebbero nascosto i corpi in un luogo a loro connesso.
Turkish (TR): Eğer suçlular gerçekten hizmetkârlar olsaydı, cesetleri kendilerine bağlı bir yere saklamazlardı.

Umineko Project (UP): Certainly not the rose garden storehouse of all places, whose key they themselves controlled.
Steam (ST): Why on Earth would they use the rose garden shed if they were the ones in charge of the key that could unlock it?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There were other places besides the rose garden storehouse, whose key they themselves controlled.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分たちが鍵を管理する薔薇庭園の倉庫などもってのほかだ。
Russian (RU): Помимо кладовой в розарии, ключом к которой они распоряжались, существовали другие места.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Certamente não no depósito perto do jardim das rosas, de todos os lugares, cuja chave eles mesmos controlam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由自己管轄鑰匙的玫瑰庭園的倉庫之類更是毫無道理。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由自己管辖钥匙的玫瑰庭园的仓库之类更是毫无道理。
Italian (IT): Non aveva senso che avessero scelto il magazzino del roseto, di cui detenevano la chiave.
Turkish (TR): Hele ki anahtarı kendilerinin kontrolünde olan gül bahçesi ambarına hiç.

Umineko Project (UP): The police would probably immediately pursue whoever had been in control of the key.
Steam (ST): The police would probably immediately pursue whoever had been in control of the key.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The police would probably immediately pursue whoever had been in control of the key.
PC Japanese (JP): 警察は真っ先に鍵の管理方法などで追求してくるだろう。
Russian (RU): Полиция наверняка сразу же начнёт обрабатывать тех, кто распоряжался ключом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A polícia provavelmente perseguiria imediatamente aqueles que tinham controle sobre as chaves.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 警察第一個會追究的應該就是鑰匙的管理方式。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 警察第一个会追究的应该就是钥匙的管理方式。
Italian (IT): L'amministrazione delle chiavi sarebbe stata la primissima pista seguita dalla polizia.
Turkish (TR): Polis muhtemelen anahtarı kontrol eden kişinin peşine düşerdi.

Umineko Project (UP): That would create a danger for exposure.{n}......If we were to assume that they were the culprits, they had no reason to carry the bodies into the storehouse.
Steam (ST): It was even possible that some other facts might come to light as a result. ...The more we think of the servants as the culprits, the less reason they had to carry the bodies into the storehouse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That would create a danger for exposure.......If we were to assume that they were the culprits, they had no reason to carry the bodies into the storehouse.
PC Japanese (JP): そこから何かが露呈する危険もある。……彼らが犯人であると仮定すればするほど、倉庫に遺体を移す理由がない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そこから何かが露呈する危険もある。{n}……彼らが犯人であると仮定すればするほど、倉庫に遺体を移す理由がない。
Russian (RU): То есть возникает риск разоблачения.{n}......Если допустить, что преступниками являются они, им было незачем переносить тела в кладовую.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso criaria um perigo de exposição.{n}......Se tivéssemos que assumir que eles são os culpados, eles não teriam razão para levar os corpos para o depósito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這一點就有暴露出什麼的危險。{n}……越是假定他們是犯人，就越沒有把遺體轉移到倉庫的理由。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这一点就有暴露出什么的危险。{n}……越是假定他们是犯人，就越没有把遗体转移到仓库的理由。
Italian (IT): C'era il pericolo che potessero risalire a qualcosa... Più si assumeva che i domestici fossero i colpevoli, meno venivano fuori ragioni per cui avrebbero dovuto spostare i corpi nel magazzino...
Turkish (TR): Bu da açığa çıkma tehlikesi yaratırdı.{n}......Eğer suçluların onlar olduğunu varsayacak olursak, cesetleri ambara taşımaları için hiçbir sebepleri yoktu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Did they expect us to think that, and so put them in the storehouse deliberately?{n}No, that definitely didn't make sense.
Steam (ST): ...But what if they knew we'd think that, and put the corpses in the storehouse for that very reason? No, that's completely impossible.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...If you twist that around, why did they purposefully put them in the storehouse? No, that definitely didn't make sense.
PC Japanese (JP): …というのを逆手にとって、わざと倉庫に置いたのか？いや、それだけは断じてありえない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …というのを逆手にとって、わざと倉庫に置いたのか？{n}いや、それだけは断じてありえない。
Russian (RU): ...Но если взглянуть на это с другой стороны, зачем им было нарочно помещать тела в кладовую?{n}Нет, в этом определённо не было никакого смысла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Eles esperavam que pensássemos isso, e então os colocaram dentro do depósito deliberadamente?{n}Não, isso definitivamente não faz sentido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …難不成是將計就計，故意放在倉庫裡的嗎？{n}不，只有這是斷然不可能的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …难不成是将计就计，故意放在仓库里的吗？{n}不，只有这是断然不可能的。
Italian (IT): E se li avessero messi lì apposta per depistarci? No, la cosa non aveva decisamente alcun senso.
Turkish (TR): ...Böyle düşünmemizi istediler ve bu yüzden mi onları kasıtlı olarak ambara koydular?{n}Hayır, bu kesinlikle mantıklı değil.

Umineko Project (UP): When the police come and inspect the site, all kinds of things will probably become clear.
Steam (ST): When the police come and inspect the scene of the crime, they'll probably be able to uncover many things.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When the police come and inspect the site, several things will probably become clear.
PC Japanese (JP): 警察が来て現場検証を行えば、様々なことが判明するだろう。
Russian (RU): Когда полиция прибудет и осмотрит место преступления, что‐нибудь наверняка всплывёт.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando a polícia vier e inspecionar o local, todas as coisas provavelmente vão ficar claras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 想來，只要警察來進行現場取證，就會查明不少事情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 想来，只要警察来进行现场取证，就会查明不少事情。
Italian (IT): Una volta che sarebbe giunta la polizia ad ispezionare sul posto, sarebbero stati svelati diversi elementi.
Turkish (TR): Polis gelip olay yerini incelediğinde muhtemelen her şey ortaya çıkacaktır.

Umineko Project (UP): No matter how deeply careful the culprits were in carrying out murder, some kind of traces will definitely be found.
Steam (ST): No matter how carefully the culprits carried out that murder, some traces will definitely be found.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No matter how deeply careful the culprits were in carrying out murder, some kind of traces will definitely be found.
PC Japanese (JP): 犯人たちがどんなに注意深く殺人を実行しようとも、必ず何かの痕跡を発見される。
Russian (RU): Неважно, насколько аккуратны были преступники при совершении убийства, наверняка будут обнаружены какие‐нибудь следы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não importa quão extremamente cuidadosos os culpados foram na execução dos assassinatos, algum tipo de pista definitivamente será encontrada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 無論犯人們如何小心謹慎地殺人，都必然會留下什麼蜘絲馬跡被發現。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 无论犯人们如何小心谨慎地杀人，都必然会留下什么蜘丝马迹被发现。
Italian (IT): Per quanto i colpevoli siano stati accorti nel compiere i loro omicidi, sarebbero sicuramente venute fuori delle tracce.
Turkish (TR): Suçlular cinayeti işlerken ne kadar dikkatli davranmış olurlarsa olsunlar, mutlaka birtakım izler bulunacaktır.

Umineko Project (UP): So, in summary, they have everything to lose and nothing to gain.
Steam (ST): In other words, they had everything to lose and nothing to gain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, in summary, they had everything to lose and nothing to gain.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、彼らにとって百害はあっても一利はないのだ。
Russian (RU): В итоге от этого слуги ничего не выигрывали, а только всё теряли.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, em suma, eles têm tudo a perder e nada a ganhar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，這對他們而言有百害而無一利。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，这对他们而言有百害而无一利。
Italian (IT): Ergo, i colpevoli avevano tutto da perdere, e nulla da guadagnare.
Turkish (TR): Yani özetle, kaybedecek her şeyleri var ama kazanacak hiçbir şeyleri yok.

Umineko Project (UP): If you think about it this way, and look at the game from the culprit's side, it feels like there's no point in advertising the location of the corpses.
Steam (ST): If you think about it this way and look at this murder game from the culprit's side, it's hard to imagine why they'd want to call attention to the corpses.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If you think about it this way, and look at the game from the culprit's side, it would seem pointless for them to let the corpses be found.
PC Japanese (JP): こうして考えると、犯人サイドからこの殺人ゲームを見た場合、遺体をアピールすることに意味が感じられない。
Russian (RU): Если представить всё так и взглянуть на игру со стороны преступника, то указание на местоположение тел не имеет для него смысла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se você pensar sobre isso dessa forma e olhar para o caso na visão do culpado, parece que não há motivo para revelar a localização dos cadáveres.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這麼一想的話，以犯人的角度來審視一番這盤殺人遊戲，便根本感覺不到展示遺體有任何意義。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这么一想的话，以犯人的角度来审视一番这盘杀人游戏，便根本感觉不到展示遗体有任何意义。
Italian (IT): Ragionando in questo modo, e guardando il gioco dal punto di vista del colpevole, non si riusciva a trovare una motivazione valida per aver attirato l'attenzione sui cadaveri.
Turkish (TR): Bu şekilde düşünürseniz ve oyuna suçluların açısından bakarsanız, cesetlerin yerinin reklamını yapmanın bir anlamı yokmuş gibi geliyor.

Umineko Project (UP): If the bodies were found, a report would be sent to the police, the remaining people would become more cautious, they could start looking for who was responsible, ...anyway, none of these things would make the culprits feel any more comfortable.
Steam (ST): Once the corpses were found, it could result in someone sending a report to the police, or it might make the remaining people more cautious, or it might make the survivors start to search for the culprit. None of these things would make life any easier for the culprit. ...It's just like the words of the main character's mother in a novel I read recently, called "Higurashi No Naku Koro Ni". Every story needs to have a beginning, a middle, and an end.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If the bodies were found, a report would be sent to the police, the remaining people would become even more cautious, and they could start looking for the culprit, ...anyway, none of these things would make the culprit feel any more comfortable.
PC Japanese (JP): 遺体が見付かれば、警察への通報とか、残った人間たちが用心深くなるとか、犯人探しを始めるとか、…とにかく犯人にとって居心地のよくなることは何一つ起こらない。
Russian (RU): Если тела обнаруживаются, то уведомляется полиция, оставшиеся люди становятся ещё осторожнее и могут начать поиски преступника...... в общем, преступнику от этого спокойнее явно не станет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se os corpos fossem encontrados, uma notificação seria enviada à polícia, as pessoas restantes poderiam se tornar mais cautelosas, elas poderiam começar a procurar quem era o responsável, ...de qualquer forma, nenhuma destas coisas faria os culpados se sentirem mais confortáveis.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 若是遺體被發現，就會有人去報警，剩下來的人也會變得小心翼翼，還會開始找犯人，…總之能讓犯人感覺舒坦的事是一個都不會有。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 若是遗体被发现，就会有人去报警，剩下来的人也会变得小心翼翼，还会开始找犯人，…总之能让犯人感觉舒坦的事是一个都不会有。
Italian (IT): Una volta trovati i corpi, sarebbe stato inviato un rapporto alla polizia, le persone rimaste in vita sarebbero state ancora più caute, e si sarebbe iniziato a cercare i colpevoli... Niente di tutto questo avrebbe reso la vita più facile ai responsabili...Proprio come aveva detto la madre del protagonista di un romanzo che avevo letto di recente, dal nome di "Quando le Cicale Piangeranno".
Turkish (TR): Cesetler bulunursa, polise bir ihbar yapılacak, geride kalan insanlar daha temkinli olacak, kimin sorumlu olduğunu aramaya başlayabileceklerdi, ...her neyse, bunların hiçbiri suçluların daha rahat hissetmesini sağlamayacaktı.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Just like the words of the main character's mother in a novel I read recently called {i:Higurashi no Naku Koro ni}.
Steam (ST): Eliminating that "beginning" is essential for the perfect crime.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Just like the words of the main character's mother in a novel I read recently called "Higurashi no naku koro ni".
PC Japanese (JP): …最近読んだ『ひぐらしのなく頃に』とかいう小説でも主人公の母親が言ってたぜ。
Russian (RU): ...Совсем как слова матери главного героя в недавно прочитанной мною новелле "Когда плачут цикады".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Assim como as palavras da mãe de um personagem principal, em um romance que eu li recentemente, chamado {i:Higurashi no Naku Koro ni}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …最近讀過的小說『寒蟬鳴泣之時』裡主人公的母親也有說過：
Chinese Simplified (CN): …最近读过的小说『寒蝉鸣泣之时』里主人公的母亲也有说过：
Italian (IT): Un romanzo classico si divide in quattro parti: introduzione, sviluppo, svolta, e conclusione.
Turkish (TR): ...Tıpkı geçenlerde okuduğum {i:Higurashi no Naku Koro ni} adlı romandaki ana karakterin annesinin sözleri gibi.

Umineko Project (UP): A mystery story has four parts—introduction, development, turn, and conclusion—and so, to commit the perfect crime, it is essential to eliminate the "introduction".
Steam (ST): ...Right now, we don't know where Grandfather is.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A mystery story had four parts: introduction, development, turn and conclusion. Eliminating the first part was essential for the perfect crime.
PC Japanese (JP): 完全犯罪ってのは、“起承転結の「起」”を起こさないことが肝要だと。
Russian (RU): Детективная история делится на четыре части: введение, развитие, кульминация и заключение. Исключение первой части является необходимостью для совершения идеального преступления.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma história de mistério tem quatro partes — introdução, desenvolvimento, reviravolta e conclusão — e então, para cometer o crime perfeito, é essencial eliminar a "introdução".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所謂完全犯罪，不讓“起承轉結的「起」”發生是其中的核心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所谓完全犯罪，不让“起承转结的「起」”发生是其中的核心。
Italian (IT): Far sì che l'introduzione non avvenga è essenziale per realizzare il delitto perfetto...
Turkish (TR): Bir gizem öyküsü—giriş, gelişme, geriye dönüş ve sonuç—olmak üzere dört bölümden oluşur ve bu nedenle mükemmel bir suç işlemek için "giriş" bölümünü ortadan kaldırmak şarttır.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Right now, no one knew where Grandfather was.
Steam (ST): We don't know if he's already become a victim or if he's one of the culprits,
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……今、祖父さまの姿が見えない。
Russian (RU): ......На данный момент никто не знает, куда подевался дедушка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Agora, ninguém sabia onde o vovô estava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……現在，爺爺不見踪影。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……现在，爷爷不见踪影。
Italian (IT): In quel momento, nessuno era riuscito a trovare il nonno.
Turkish (TR): ......Şu anda kimse Büyükbabanın nerede olduğunu bilmiyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): We didn't know whether he had already become a victim, or if he was one of the culprits, .........but this state of confusion had to be beneficial to whoever did this.
Steam (ST): ......but this state of confusion must be beneficial to the killer. The culprit has absolutely nothing to gain by showing us the bodies in such a obvious way and making us all realize there's been a murder.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We didn't know whether he had already become a victim, or if he was one of the culprits, .........but this state of confusion had to be beneficial to the culprit.
PC Japanese (JP): すでに犠牲になっているのか、あるいは犯人の１人なのかはわからないが、………このわからない状態の方が、犯人にとっては好都合のはず。
Russian (RU): Мы даже не знали, стал ли он жертвой или был одним из преступников............ но такая неразбериха должна играть на руку преступнику.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós não sabíamos se ele já havia se tornado uma vítima ou se ele era um dos culpados, .........mas esse estado de confusão tinha que ser benéfico para quem fez isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然不知道他是已經成為了犧牲者，還是他就是犯人中的一個，………但是這種搞不清楚的狀況，對犯人來說應該是正好。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然不知道他是已经成为了牺牲者，还是他就是犯人中的一个，………但是这种搞不清楚的状况，对犯人来说应该是正好。
Italian (IT): Non sapevamo se fosse già divenuto una vittima, o se fosse uno dei colpevoli...ma la nostra inconsapevolezza avrebbe giovato ai criminali.
Turkish (TR): Çoktan kurban mı olmuştu yoksa suçlulardan biri miydi bilmiyorduk, .........ancak bu kafa karışıklığı durumu, bunu her kim yaptıysa onun işine yaramış olmalı.

Umineko Project (UP): By blatantly advertising the bodies to us, and declaring "Hey! There's a murder case going on!", the culprit had absolutely nothing to gain.
Steam (ST): In fact, this is the perfect place to "spin the chessboard around". In other words, showing us the corpses in such a flashy way must be the culprit's goal in and of itself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): By showing us the bodies that obviously, and making us all realize there is a murder case going on, the culprit had absolutely nothing to gain.
PC Japanese (JP): 遺体をこれ見よがしにアピールして、殺人事件がさぁ起こりましたよなんて宣伝するのは、まったく犯人にとって得るものがない。
Russian (RU): От открытой демонстрации тел, заставившей нас осознать, что произошло убийство, преступник абсолютно ничего не выигрывал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao mostrar abertamente os corpos para nós, e declarando "Ei! Há um caso de assassinato acontecendo aqui!", o culpado não tinha absolutamente nada a ganhar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 賣弄般地展示出遺體，還大肆宣傳“發生殺人事件了哦”，這些對犯人來說是沒一點好處的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 卖弄般地展示出遗体，还大肆宣传“发生杀人事件了哦”，这些对犯人来说是没一点好处的。
Italian (IT): I colpevoli non avrebbero ricavato nulla dal mostrarci i corpi in un modo così ovvio, e dal rendere palese che fossero avvenuti degli omicidi.
Turkish (TR): Cesetlerin reklamını bize pervasızca yaparak, ve "Hey! Burada bir cinayet davası var!" diye ilan ederek, suçlunun kazanacağı bir şey kesinlikle yoktu.

Umineko Project (UP): Right, that was where we could "flip over the chessboard".
Steam (ST): ...So, at the very least, to the culprit,
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Right, that was where we could 'turn the chessboard over'.
PC Japanese (JP): いや、そこでこそ“チェス盤をひっくり返す”ところさ。
Russian (RU): Точно, вот где мы можем развернуть шахматную доску.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Certo, era aqui que poderíamos "virar o tabuleiro".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不對，此處正是需要“把國際象棋盤翻轉過來”的地方。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不对，此处正是需要“把国际象棋盘翻转过来”的地方。
Italian (IT): No, era giunto il momento di ‘rigirare la scacchiera’.
Turkish (TR): Doğru, "satranç tahtasını ters çevireceğimiz" yer işte burasıydı.

Umineko Project (UP): So this blatant advertisement of the bodies was itself the culprit's goal.
Steam (ST): {i:the appearance of six corpses there meant}
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So the culprit's goal was to clearly show us the bodies.
PC Japanese (JP): なら、このこれ見よがしなアピールは犯人の目的そのものってことになる。
Russian (RU): Итак, целью преступника было показать нам тела.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Portanto, essa mostra descarada dos cadáveres era o objetivo do culpado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那麼這個賣弄般的展示才是犯人的目的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那么这个卖弄般的展示才是犯人的目的。
Italian (IT): Pertanto, l'obiettivo dei colpevoli era quello di mostrarceli...
Turkish (TR): Yani cesetlerin bu bariz reklamı suçlunun amacının bizzat kendisiydi.

Umineko Project (UP): ......So, it may well be that, to the culprit, {i:having the six corpses be present there meant more than the deaths themselves}.
Steam (ST): {i:more than the deaths themselves}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......So, at the very least, to the culprit,
PC Japanese (JP): ……つまり犯人にとっては下手すると、{i:殺すことよりも、あそこに６人の死体を用意する方が意味があったってことになる}。
Russian (RU): ......Так что для преступника, как минимум, {i:демонстрация тел имела большее значение, чем сами смерти}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Então, pode muito bem ser que, para o culpado, {i:ter exposto os seis cadáveres significou mais do que as próprias mortes}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……搞不好對犯人來說，{i:比起殺人，在那個地方準備六具屍體，才是有意義的事}。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……搞不好对犯人来说，{i:比起杀人，在那个地方准备六具尸体，才是有意义的事}。
Italian (IT): Voleva dire che per i colpevoli, nella peggiore delle ipotesi, {i:disporre lì quei corpi, fosse persino più importante di ucciderli}.
Turkish (TR): ......Dolayısıyla, suçlu için {i:altı cesedin orada bulunması, ölümlerin kendisinden daha fazla anlam ifade ediyor olabilir}.

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, the culprit wanted to display these murders. To who?
Steam (ST): In other words, the culprit wanted this murder on display. To whom?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): the appearance of the corpses there meant more than the deaths themselves. In other words, the culprit wanted to display this murder. To who?
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、犯人はこの殺人を誇示しているわけだ。誰に？
Russian (RU): Другими словами, преступник хотел выставить это убийство на обозрение. На чьё обозрение?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, o culpado queria mostrar esses assassinatos. Para quem?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，犯人是在炫耀此次殺人。對誰？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，犯人是在炫耀此次杀人。对谁？
Italian (IT): In altre parole, i colpevoli volevano ostentare quegli omicidi. Ma a chi...?
Turkish (TR): Başka bir deyişle, suçlu bu cinayetleri sergilemek istemiştir. Kime?

Umineko Project (UP): ......To us. It was a message.{n}The culprit was trying to shove something in our faces.
Steam (ST): ...To us. This is a message. The culprit's trying to shove something in our faces.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......To us. It was a message from them. The culprit was trying to shove something in our faces.
PC Japanese (JP): ……俺たちにだ。こいつはメッセージだ。犯人たちは俺たちに、何かを突きつけている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……俺たちにだ。こいつはメッセージだ。{n}犯人たちは俺たちに、何かを突きつけている。
Russian (RU): ......На наше. Это было послание от них.{n}Преступник пытался что‐то бросить нам в лицо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Para nós. Isso foi uma mensagem.{n}O culpado estava tentando jogar algo na nossa cara.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……對我們。這是一個信息。{n}犯人們是將什麼，擺在了我們面前。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……对我们。这是一个信息。{n}犯人们是将什么，摆在了我们面前。
Italian (IT): A noi. Era un messaggio. I colpevoli stavano cercando di sfregarci qualcosa in faccia...
Turkish (TR): ......Bize. Bu bir mesajdı.{n}Suçlu gözümüze bir şey sokmaya çalışıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...I didn't know what that could be.
Steam (ST): ...I don't know what it is.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …それが何か、わからない。
Russian (RU): ...Я не имею понятия, что бы это могло быть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Eu não sei o que poderia ser.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …而它是什麼，還不知道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …而它是什么，还不知道。
Italian (IT): E non avevo idea di cosa potesse essere.
Turkish (TR): ...Bunun ne olabileceğini bilmiyordum.

Umineko Project (UP): At the current time, none of us could grasp anything from this vulgar mass murder except malice.
Steam (ST): At this point in time, this vulgar mass murder isn't making me feel anything except a malice directed towards all of us.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At the current time, none of us could grasp anything from this vulgar mass murder except malice.
PC Japanese (JP): 現時点では、この趣味の悪い大量殺人は、俺たち全員への悪意以上のものは感じ取れない。
Russian (RU): Сейчас в этом жутком массовом убийстве мы не могли ощущать ничего, кроме злобы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No momento, nenhum de nós podia compreender nada desse vulgar assassinato em massa, exceto a malícia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 現階段，從這起變態趣味的大量殺人案上，除了對我們所有人的惡意以外，什麼都感覺不出。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 现阶段，从这起变态趣味的大量杀人案上，除了对我们所有人的恶意以外，什么都感觉不出。
Italian (IT): In tale momento, quella strage spietata non mi sembrava comunicare altro che non fosse disprezzo rivolto verso di noi...
Turkish (TR): Şu anda hiçbirimiz bu vahşi toplu katliamdan kötülük duygusu dışında bir şey anlayamıyorduk.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Malice towards...everyone...perhaps.
Steam (ST): ......Malice towards... all of us, ...is it?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Malice towards, everyone, ...perhaps.
PC Japanese (JP): ……全員への、悪意、…か。
Russian (RU): ......Злобы, направленной... на всех...... наверное.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Malícia contra...todo mundo...possivelmente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……對我們所有人的，惡意，…嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……对我们所有人的，恶意，…吗？
Italian (IT): Forse... era odio... nei nostri confronti?
Turkish (TR): ......Herkese duyulan...bir kin...belki de.

Umineko Project (UP): Each one of the survivors had some kind of connection to one of the six who had been killed.
Steam (ST): Each one of the survivors has some kind of connection to one of the six victims.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Each one of the survivors had some kind of connection to one of the six who had been killed.
PC Japanese (JP): 殺された６人は、今、生き残っている人たち全員にとって、みんな何らかのつながりがある。
Russian (RU): Каждый из выживших был как‐то связан с одним из убитой шестёрки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Cada um dos sobreviventes tinha algum tipo de ligação com pelo menos um dos seis que foram mortos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 被殺的六個人，對於現在活下來的所有人來說，都是存在著某種聯繫的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 被杀的六个人，对于现在活下来的所有人来说，都是存在着某种联系的。
Italian (IT): Ognuno dei sopravvissuti aveva dei legami con una delle sei vittime.
Turkish (TR): Hayatta kalanların her birinin öldürülen altı kişiden biriyle bir tür bağı vardı.

Umineko Project (UP): Uncle Krauss's death brought sorrow to Jessica's family.
Steam (ST): Uncle Krauss's death brought Jessica the grief of losing a family member.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Krauss oji-san's death brought Jessica the grief of losing one of her family.
PC Japanese (JP): 蔵臼伯父さんの死は、朱志香の一家に悲しみを与えた。
Russian (RU): Смерть дяди Краусса нанесла удар по семье Джессики.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A morte do tio Krauss trouxe tristeza à família de Jessica.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 藏臼伯父的死，把悲傷帶給了朱志香一家。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 藏臼伯父的死，把悲伤带给了朱志香一家。
Italian (IT): La morte di Zio Klaus aveva inferto dolore alla famiglia di Jessica.
Turkish (TR): Krauss Amca'nın ölümü Jessica'nın ailesine keder getirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): The deaths of Dad and Kyrie‐san brought sorrow to me, while Auntie Rosa's death brought sorrow to Maria.
Steam (ST): The deaths of Dad and Kyrie-san brought me sorrow, while Aunt Rosa's death brought Maria sorrow.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The deaths of Dad and Kyrie-san brought me sorrow, while Rosa oba-san's death brought Maria sorrow.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺の親父と霧江さんの死は、俺に悲しみを与え、楼座叔母さんの死は真里亞に悲しみを与えた。
Russian (RU): Смерть отца и Кирие‐сан заставили горевать меня, а смерть тёти Розы — Марию.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As mortes do meu pai e da Kyrie‐san trouxeram tristeza a mim, enquanto a morte da tia Rosa trouxe tristeza à Maria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我的老爸和霧江姐的死，把悲傷帶給了我，樓座姑母的死把悲傷帶給了真里亞。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我的老爸和雾江姐的死，把悲伤带给了我，楼座姑母的死把悲伤带给了真里亚。
Italian (IT): Le morti di papà e di Kirie-san mi avevano portato sofferenza, mentre quella di Zia Rosa aveva fatto soffrire Maria...
Turkish (TR): Babamın ve Kyrie-san'ın ölümü bana, Rosa Teyze'nin ölümü ise Maria'ya keder getirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Gohda‐san's death probably dealt a shock to his fellow servants, and Shannon‐chan's death brought grief to George‐aniki, who had proposed to her, and to Kanon‐kun, who had loved her like an older sister.
Steam (ST): ......Gohda-san's death probably shocked his fellow servants, and Shannon-chan's death brought grief both to George-aniki, who had proposed to her, and Kanon-kun, who had loved her like an older sister.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Gohda-san's death probably influenced his fellow servants, and Shannon-chan's death brought grief to George-aniki, who had proposed to her, and Kanon-kun, who had loved her like an older sister.
PC Japanese (JP): ……郷田さんの死は使用人仲間に衝撃を与えただろうし、紗音ちゃんの死は、婚約した譲治の兄貴や、姉と慕っていた嘉音くんに悲しみを与えた。
Russian (RU): ......Смерть Годы‐сан наверняка шокировала его коллег‐слуг, а смерть Шаннон‐чан убила Джорджа‐аники, сделавшего ей предложение, и Канон‐куна, любившего её как старшую сестру.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A morte do Gohda‐san provavelmente causou um choque em seus companheiros de serviço, e a morte da Shannon‐chan causou dor ao George‐aniki, que tinha pedido ela em casamento, e também ao Kanon‐kun, que a tinha amado como uma irmã mais velha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……鄉田的死應該是讓其他傭人同事們受了精神打擊，而紗音的死也是把悲傷帶給了，訂下婚約的讓治大哥，和把她當姐姐一般敬仰的嘉音君。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……乡田的死应该是让其他佣人同事们受了精神打击，而纱音的死也是把悲伤带给了，订下婚约的让治大哥，和把她当姐姐一般敬仰的嘉音君。
Italian (IT): La morte di Gouda-san probabilmente aveva sconvolto i suoi colleghi domestici, e la morte di Shannon-chan aveva causato dolore sia al fratellone George, che le si era dichiarato, che a Kanon-kun, che l'amava come una sorella maggiore...
Turkish (TR): ......Gohda-san'ın ölümü muhtemelen hizmetkâr arkadaşlarını şoka uğratmış, Shannon-chan'ın ölümü ise ona evlenme teklif eden George-aniki'yi ve adeta ablası gibi seven Kanon-kun'u üzüntüye boğmuştur.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Everyone now on this island had received an equal amount of sadness.
Steam (ST): ......Everyone now on this island has received an equal amount of sadness.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……今この島にいる誰もに、均等に悲しみを与えているのだ。
Russian (RU): ......Каждому на этом острове перепала равная доля горя.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Todos nesta ilha receberam uma quantidade igual tristeza.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……在這座島上的每個人，都被均等地帶來了悲傷。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……在这座岛上的每个人，都被均等地带来了悲伤。
Italian (IT): All'interno di quell'isola, tutti noi eravamo similmente in lutto.
Turkish (TR): ......Şu anda bu adada bulunan herkes eşit miktarda kedere maruz kalmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): Auntie Eva had claimed that the servants were definitely in cahoots, ......but then how could you explain the deaths of Gohda‐san and Shannon‐chan?
Steam (ST): Aunt Eva was sure that the servants were in cahoots, ...but then, how could you explain the deaths of Gohda-san and Shannon-chan?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eva oba-san had claimed that the servants were definitely in cahoots, ......but then how could you explain the deaths of Gohda-san and Shannon-chan?
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽伯母さんは、使用人たちがグルに違いないと言い切ったが、……なら郷田さんや紗音ちゃんの遺体はどう説明するのか。
Russian (RU): Тётя Ева объявила, что это слуги сговорились между собой......... но тогда как прикажете объяснить смерть Годы‐сан и Шаннон‐чан?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Eva havia alegado que os serviçais estavam definitivamente conspirando, ......mas então, como você explicaria as mortes de Gohda‐san e Shannon‐chan?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然繪羽姑母一口咬定傭人們是一伙的，……可若是這樣，那鄉田和紗音的遺體又該怎麼解釋呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然绘羽姑母一口咬定佣人们是一伙的，……可若是这样，那乡田和纱音的遗体又该怎么解释呢？
Italian (IT): Zia Eva aveva asserito che i domestici fossero in combutta tra loro... ma allora come si potevano spiegare i cadaveri di Gouda-san e di Shannon-chan...?
Turkish (TR): Eva Teyze hizmetkârların kesinlikle işbirliği içinde olduğunu iddia etmişti, ......ama o takdirde Gohda-san ve Shannon-chan'ın ölümlerini nasıl açıklayabilirdiniz?

Umineko Project (UP): ......And by this argument, {i:the grief caused by the six deaths hit everyone but Auntie Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi}.
Steam (ST): {i:...At any rate, by this argument, the grief caused by the six deaths hit everyone but Aunt Eva and Uncle Hideyoshi}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......And by this argument, the grief caused by the six deaths hit everyone but Eva oba-san and Hideyoshi oji-san .
PC Japanese (JP): ……それにこの論法で行けば、{i:この６人の死によって全員に与えられている悲しみが、絵羽伯母さんと秀吉伯父さんだけは免れている}。
Russian (RU): ......И при таком заявлении, {i:горе, причинённое шестью смертями, затронуло всех, кроме тёти Евы и дяди Хидэёши}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E por esse argumento, {i:a dor causada pelas seis mortes atingiu a todos, à exceção da tia Eva e o tio Hideyoshi}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而且這麼推理下去的話，{i:只有繪羽姑母和秀吉姑父，免於承受了這六個人的死帶給所有人的悲傷。}
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而且这么推理下去的话，{i:只有绘羽姑母和秀吉姑父，免于承受了这六个人的死带给所有人的悲伤。}
Italian (IT): E se si seguiva tale filo logico, {i:tutti erano stati colpiti dal dolore per la morte di quelle sei persone, tranne Zia Eva e Zio Hideyoshi}.
Turkish (TR): ......Ve bu argümanla, {i:altı ölümün yol açtığı keder Eva Teyze ve Hideyoshi Amca dışında herkesi etkiledi}.

Umineko Project (UP): It was very possible to doubt Auntie Eva herself, who was acting like she was outside the net of suspicion, and who might have been trying to point that suspicion at the servants.
Steam (ST): Even Aunt Eva, who had directed suspicion at the servants and acted as though she herself was beyond suspicion, could not be ruled out as a suspect.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was very possible to doubt Eva oba-san herself, who was acting like she was outside the net of suspicion, and who might have been trying to point that suspicion at the servants.
PC Japanese (JP): 使用人たちに疑いを向け、蚊帳の外を気取る絵羽伯母さん自身、疑いの余地がないとは言い切れないのだ。
Russian (RU): Такой расклад бросал подозрение и на саму тётю Еву, ведущую себя так, словно она находилась вне сети подозрения, и которая могла пытаться навести подозрение на слуг.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era bem possível duvidar da própria tia Eva, que estava agindo como se ela estivesse fora da rede de suspeitos e podia estar tentando jogar a suspeita sobre os serviçais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪羽姑母把矛頭指向傭人們，獨善其身，卻無法斷言她自身沒有可懷疑的地方。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘羽姑母把矛头指向佣人们，独善其身，却无法断言她自身没有可怀疑的地方。
Italian (IT): Nulla impediva di dubitare di zia Eva stessa, che si comportava come se fosse all'oscuro di tutto, e che aveva cercato di gettare sospetti sui domestici...
Turkish (TR): Şüphe çemberinin dışındaymış gibi davranan, ve bu şüpheyi hizmetkârlara yöneltmeye çalışan Eva Teyze'nin kendisinden şüphe etmek de pekâlâ mümkündü.

Umineko Project (UP): ......In the first place, she had managed to avoid suspicion and place it on the servants with that argument about the key to the shutter, ......but if you looked at it from a perspective of motive, about who would gain something from the murders, ............Auntie Eva's name floated to the top of the list.
Steam (ST): ...In the first place, she was able to argue that the servants were suspicious by focusing on the shutter's key, ...but if you look at it from a perspective of motive and who would gain, ......Aunt Eva's name rises to the top of the list.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......In the first place, she had managed to avoid suspicion and place it on the servants with that argument about the key to the shutter, ......but if you looked at it from a perspective of motive, about who would gain something from the murders, ............Eva oba-san's name floated to the top of the list.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そもそも、シャッターの鍵の話で煙に撒かれたから使用人が疑わしいという論法になってしまったが、……この殺人で誰が得をするのかという、動機の線から疑うと、…………絵羽伯母さんはもっとも怪しい人物に浮上する。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……そもそも、シャッターの鍵の話で煙に巻かれたから使用人が疑わしいという論法になってしまったが、……この殺人で誰が得をするのかという、動機の線から疑うと、…………絵羽伯母さんはもっとも怪しい人物に浮上する。
Russian (RU): ......Перво‐наперво ей удалось отвести от себя подозрения и своим аргументом о ключе к подъёмной двери перевести их на слуг......... но если, приняв во внимание мотив, посмотреть на тех, кто выигрывает от этих убийств............... имя тёти Евы будет в самом верху списка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Em primeiro lugar, ela tinha direcionado as suspeitas para os serviçais com o argumento a respeito da chave do {i:shutter}, ......mas se você olhar isso de outra perspectiva, sobre quem iria ganhar algo com esses assassinatos, ............o nome da tia Eva subia para o topo da lista.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……說起來，雖然我們從卷閘門鑰匙的疑團上推理到了傭人很可疑，……但若是通過動機，也就是“這次殺人事件會讓誰得到好處”這條線來懷疑的話，…………繪羽姑母就會作為最可疑的人物浮上台面。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……说起来，虽然我们从卷闸门钥匙的疑团上推理到了佣人很可疑，……但若是通过动机，也就是“这次杀人事件会让谁得到好处”这条线来怀疑的话，…………绘羽姑母就会作为最可疑的人物浮上台面。
Italian (IT): All'inizio, aveva gettato ombra sui domestici con la storia della chiave della saracinesca, per dipingerli come individui sospetti... ma se si pensava per un attimo al movente, ossia su chi avrebbe ricavato qualcosa dagli omicidi... il nome di zia Eva compariva al primo posto nella lista degli indiziati.
Turkish (TR): ......İlk etapta, kepengin anahtarıyla ilgili o tartışmayla şüphelerden kaçmayı ve suçu hizmetkârların üzerine atmayı başarmıştı, ......ama cinayetlerden kimin kazançlı çıkacağına dair bir perspektiften bakarsanız, ............Eva Teyze'nin adı listenin en başına yerleşiyordu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Umineko Project (UP): "......Battler‐kun, Auntie knows what you're thinking, okay?"
Steam (ST): "...I know what you're thinking, Battler-kun."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Battler-kun, Oba-san knows what you are thinking about, okay?"

Umineko Project (UP): Auntie Eva didn't want to talk any more than that, so I headed to the window, folding my arms, so that I could cool my head a little.
Steam (ST): Aunt Eva didn't want to talk any more than that, so I folded my arms and headed to the window to cool my head a little.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eva oba-san didn't want to talk any more than that, so I headed to the window, folding my arms, so that I could cool my head a little.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽伯母さんは、それ以上の会話を望まなかったので、俺は腕を組みながら窓辺へ行き、少し頭を冷やした。
Russian (RU): Тётя Ева не хотела больше ничего говорить, так что я, скрестив руки на груди, подошёл к окну, чтобы дать своей голове немного остыть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Eva não quis falar mais do que aquilo, então eu fui até a janela e cruzei os braços, de forma que eu pudesse esfriar um pouco a cabeça.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪羽姑母不想再把這對話繼續下去了，於是我抱著雙臂走向窗邊，稍微冷靜了一下頭腦。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘羽姑母不想再把这对话继续下去了，于是我抱着双臂走向窗边，稍微冷静了一下头脑。
Italian (IT): Dato che zia Eva non voleva più discuterne, andai verso la finestra e incrociai le braccia, calmandomi un po'.
Turkish (TR): Eva Teyze daha fazla konuşmak istemedi, ben de kafamı biraz dinlemek için kollarımı kavuşturarak pencereye yöneldim.

Umineko Project (UP): As I looked over the parlor, I saw George‐aniki and the others gathered, talking.
Steam (ST): As I looked over the parlor, I saw George-aniki and the others gathered, talking.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As I looked over the parlor, I saw George-aniki and the others gathered, talking.
PC Japanese (JP): 客間を見渡してみると、譲治の兄貴たちも集まって話をしていた。
Russian (RU): Окинув взглядом гостиную, я увидел, как Джордж‐аники и остальные собрались и что‐то обсуждают.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu olhei pela sala de visitas, e vi o George‐aniki e os outros juntos, conversando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 環視了下客廳，我看到讓治大哥他們也正聚在一起說話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 环视了下客厅，我看到让治大哥他们也正聚在一起说话。
Italian (IT): Guardando verso il salotto, vidi che il fratellone George e gli altri si erano riuniti per discutere...
Turkish (TR): Salona baktığımda George-aniki ve diğerlerinin toplandığını ve konuştuklarını gördüm.

Steam (ST): ...It looked like they were talking about the magic circle that had been painted onto the shutter.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Parecia que eles estavam falando sobre o círculo mágico pintado no {i:shutter}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …看起來，似乎在聊畫在那個捲閘門上的魔法陣的事。

Umineko Project (UP): As Uncle Hideyoshi thought back to that time, he started drawing the shape in the margins of Maria's notebook.
Steam (ST): As Uncle Hideyoshi thought back to that time, he started drawing the shape in the margins of Maria's notebook.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As Hideyoshi oji-san thought back to that time, he started drawing the shape in the margins of Maria's notebook.
PC Japanese (JP): 秀吉伯父さんは、それを思い出しながら、真里亞のノートの余白にそれを書き出している。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 秀吉姑父一边回忆那个魔法阵，一边在真里亚笔记本里的空白页上画着。

Turkish (TR): Hideyoshi Amca o zamanı düşünürken, Maria'nın defterinin kenarına şekli çizmeye başladı.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Yes, Maria is second only to Grandfather in knowledge of the occult, so she might understand what it meant.
Steam (ST): ...I see, since Maria was second only to Grandfather in knowledge of the occult, she might understand what it meant.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I see, since Maria was second only to Grandfather in knowledge of the occult, she might understand what it meant.
PC Japanese (JP): ……なるほど、祖父さまの次にオカルトに詳しい真里亞には、その意味がわかるかもしれない。
Russian (RU): ......Ясно, так как Мария была второй после дедушки в знании оккультизма, то она может знать, что означает тот круг.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Sim, a Maria é a segunda em termos de conhecimentos sobre o ocultismo, só atrás do vovô, então ela poderia saber o significado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……原來如此，對神秘學的熟悉程度僅次於爺爺的真里亞，說不定知道那是什麼意思。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……原来如此，对神秘学的熟悉程度仅次于爷爷的真里亚，说不定知道那是什么意思。
Italian (IT): Aveva senso. Maria avrebbe potuto comprenderne il significato, essendo seconda solo al nonno in termini di conoscenza dell'occulto.
Turkish (TR): ......Evet, Maria büyücülük konusunda Büyükbabamdan sonra ikinci sıradadır, bu yüzden bunun ne anlama geldiğini o anlayabilir.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Umineko Project (UP): "Hmmm, I think it was probably somethin' like that! There was a mark like a cross, but tweaked a bit."
Steam (ST): "Hmmm, I think it was probably somethin' like that! There was a mark that looked like a variation of a cross.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hmmm, I think it was probably somethin' like that! There was a mark arranged in the shape of a cross.
PC Japanese (JP): 「うーん、多分こんな感じだったと思うで！　十字架をアレンジしたみたいなマークが描かれとったんや。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「うーん、多分こんな感じだったと思うで！　十字架をアレンジしたみたいなマークが描かれとったんや」
Russian (RU): "Хм‐м, я думаю, он выглядел где‐то так! Там был знак, нарисованный в форме слегка сплюснутого креста."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hmmm, acho que provavelmente era algo assim! Havia uma marca, como uma cruz, mas um pouco contorcida."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯——，感覺大致上就是這樣吶！正中畫了個稍有加工的十字架一般的標誌吶。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯——，感觉大致上就是这样呐！正中画了个稍有加工的十字架一般的标志呐。」
Italian (IT): "Mmh, credo che sia qualcosa del genere! C'era disegnato un simbolo che ricordava una croce."
Turkish (TR): "Hmmm, sanırım böyle bir şeydi! Haç gibi bir işaret vardı ama biraz değiştirilmişti."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Umineko Project (UP): "And then, there were these closely packed strange letters all inside the outer circle like this, and there was somethin' written on all four sides of the cross, and in the empty spaces in the corners as well. It didn't look like the alphabet or somethin' like that. It was what they call ancient characters."
Steam (ST): And then, surroundin' the circle all around the perimeter were these closely packed strange letters on all four sides of the cross, and in the four corners, there was somethin' written. It didn't look like the alphabet or somethin' like that. It was what they call ancient characters."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And then, surroundin' the circle all around the perimeter were these closely packed strange letters, on all four sides of the cross, and in the four corners, there was somethin' written. It didn't look like the alphabet or somethin' like that. It was what they call ancient characters."
PC Japanese (JP): そして、こんな感じで外周の円を取り囲むように妙な文字がびっしり書き込まれていて、十字架の上下左右の辺と、その四隅にも何か書かれていたんや。アルファベットとかそういうのとちゃうで。あれはよく言う古代文字とかいうやつや。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そして、こんな感じで外周の円を取り囲むように妙な文字がびっしり書き込まれていて、十字架の上下左右の辺と、その四隅にも何か書かれていたんや。アルファベットとかそういうのとちゃうで。あれはよく言う古代文字とかいうやつや」
Russian (RU): "А по периметру его окружали находящиеся близко друг к другу странные буквы, а в четырёх концах креста и в четырёх углах тоже было написано что‐то странное. Это не было похоже на какой‐то алфавит или нечто подобное. Скорее, их стоило бы назвать древними символами."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E também haviam essas pequenas letras estranhas em volta do círculo e algo escrito nos quatro cantos da cruz, e também espaços vazios nos cantos. Não parecia o alfabeto e nem nada do tipo. Era o que chamam de caracteres antigos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「然後，周圍像這樣密密麻麻地寫滿了古怪的文字，就像環繞著外圍的圈似的，十字架的四周和四角裡也寫著什麼吶。不是希臘字母之類的。是常說的那種古代文字吶。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「然后，周围像这样密密麻麻地写满了古怪的文字，就像环绕着外围的圈似的，十字架的四周和四角里也写着什么呐。不是希腊字母之类的。是常说的那种古代文字呐。」
Italian (IT): "E poi, era circondato da vari caratteri disposti a cerchio in questo modo, ed era scritto qualcosa sia nei lati che negli angoli della croce. Non mi sembrava alfabeto latino. Erano una specie di scrittura antica."
Turkish (TR): "Ve sonra, dış dairenin içinde bu şekilde birbirine yakın garip harfler vardı ve haçın dört tarafında ve köşelerdeki boş alanlarda da bir şeyler yazıyordu. Alfabe ya da onun gibi bir şeye benzemiyordu. Antik karakterler dedikleri bir şeydi."

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): "......Also, around the top of the circumference, there was a small mark. ...Five small circles arranged in a plus sign, and straight lines connecting them..."
Steam (ST): "...And, around the top of the circumference, there was a small mark. ...Five small circles arranged in a + sign, and straight lines connecting them..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......After that, around the top of the circumference, there was a small mark. ...Five small circles arranged in a + sign, and straight lines connecting them..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……あと、円周部の頂点に小さなマークがありましたな。…小さな丸を５つ、十字状に並べ、それぞれを直線で結んだようなマークでした…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……あと、円周部の頂点に小さなマークがありましたな。…小さな丸を５つ、十字状に並べ、それぞれを直線で結んだようなマークでした…」
Russian (RU): "......А ещё в верхней части между двумя окружностями находился небольшой знак. ...Пять маленьких кругов, составленных в виде знака + и соединённых прямыми линиями..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Ah, no topo, acima da circunferência, havia uma pequena marca. ...Cinco pequenos círculos, organizados em um sinal de mais e linhas retas conectando eles..."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……还有，在圆的顶端有个小标志。…这标志就像是五个小圆圈排成十字状，然后分别用直线连起来一样…」
Italian (IT): "...Inoltre, sopra alla circonferenza c'era un piccolo simbolo... Erano cinque cerchietti disposti a mo' di croce, uniti da delle linee rette..."
Turkish (TR): "......Ayrıca, çemberin üst kısmında küçük bir işaret vardı. ...Artı işareti şeklinde dizilmiş beş küçük daire ve onları birleştiren düz çizgiler..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Umineko Project (UP): "Ah, yes, there definitely was somethin' like that drawn there...! Yep, this was it, there's no mistakin' the shape. I don't know the exact characters, but the arrangement was nearly the same."
Steam (ST): "Ah, yeah, there definitely was somethin' like that drawn there...! Yep, there's no mistakin' the shape. I don't understand the thin characters, but the arrangement was nearly the same."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Ah, yes, there definitely was somethin' like that drawn there... Yep, there's no mistakin' the shape. I don't understand the thin characters, but the arrangement was nearly the same."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あぁ、確かにそんなのも描いてあったで…！　うん、図形的には間違いなくこれや。細かい文字はわからんが、配列はほぼ同じや」
Russian (RU): "Ах да, там точно было нарисовано что‐то похожее... Да, по поводу формы нет никаких сомнений. Я не припомню тонких символов, но расположение было примерно таким же."

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊啊，確實也畫著這種東西吶…！嗯，圖形不會錯了就是這個吶。雖然不知道那些小文字是啥，但是排列位置基本畫得是一樣的吶。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊啊，确实也画着这种东西呐…！嗯，图形不会错了就是这个呐。虽然不知道那些小文字是啥，但是排列位置基本画得是一样的呐。」
Italian (IT): "Ah, effettivamente c'era raffigurato qualcosa del genere...! Già, non c'è dubbio sulla forma. Non capisco i caratteri minuti, ma la disposizione è pressoché identica."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "...Grandfather's about the only one who'd get it into his head to draw this nonsense. ......Seriously, where did he go?! I wanna grab him and ask what the hell this is supposed to mean!!"
Steam (ST): "...Grandfather's probably the only one who'd wanna draw something this weird. ...Seriously, where did he go?! I wanna grab him and ask what the hell this is supposed to mean!!"

Umineko Project (UP): While everyone was scared out of their wits, Maria, alone, kept on cackling happily...
Steam (ST): While everyone was busy being scared out of their wits, Maria kept on cackling happily by herself...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 誰もが度肝を抜かれている間、真里亞はひとり、機嫌良さそうにけたけたと笑い続けていた…。
Russian (RU): Её смех напугал нас всех до беспамятства и потери дара речи, поэтому она продолжила счастливо смеяться в одиночку...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 在我们全都惊得六神无主的时候，只有真里亚一个人心情很愉快似的，不停地怪笑着…。

Turkish (TR): Herkes korkudan aklını kaçırmışken, Maria tek başına neşe içinde kıkırdamaya devam ediyordu...

Umineko Project (UP): After a while, that laugh suddenly and abruptly cut off.
Steam (ST): After a while, that laugh was suddenly and abruptly cut off.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 过了一会儿，这笑声戛然而止。

Turkish (TR): Bir süre sonra, bu kahkaha aniden ve beklenmedik bir şekilde kesildi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Umineko Project (UP): "Written on the four arms of the cross are the names of the angels who preside over air, fire, water, and earth. Chasan, Arel, Talihad, and Phorlakh. And in the four diagonal directions are the names of the four great rulers. Ariel, Seraph, Tharshis, Cherub. ...Do they match?"
Steam (ST): "Written on the top and bottom and left and right are the names of the angels who preside over wind, fire, earth and water. Chasan, Arel, Phorlakh, and Taliahad. And in the four corners are the names of the four great kings. Ariel, Seraph, Tharshis, and Cherub. ...Is that what you saw?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Written on the top and bottom and left and right are the names of the angels who preside over wind, fire, earth and water. Chasan, Arel, Phorlakh, and Taliahad. And in the four corners are the names of the four great kings. Ariel., Seraph, Tharshis, and Cherub. ...Do they match?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「天地と左右に書かれているのは風火水土を司る天使たちの名。$Free1そして斜め四方には四大の王たちの名。$Free1…合ってる？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「天地と左右に書かれているのは風火水土を司る天使たちの名。Chasan、Arel、Taliahad、そしてPhorlakh。そして斜め四方には四大の統治者たちの名。Ariel、Seraph、Tharshis、Cherub。…合ってる？」
Russian (RU): "На четырёх рукавах креста написаны имена ангелов, главенствующих над воздухом, огнём, водой и землёй. Хасан, Ариэль, Талиахад и Форлах. А на четырёх углах написаны имена четырёх правителей элементов. Ариэль, Сераф, Таршис и Херуб. ...Ну как, совпадают?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Nos quatro braços da cruz estavam escritos os nomes dos anjos que presidem o ar, o fogo, a água e a terra. Chasan, Arel, Talihad e Phorlakh. E nas quatro direções diagonais, os nomes dos quatro grandes governantes. Ariel, Seraph, Tharshis e Cherub. ...Os caracteres batem?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「寫在上下和左右的是掌管風火水土的天使們的名字。Chasan、Arel、Taliahad，還有 Phorlakh。而寫在四個斜角上的是四大統治者們的名字。Ariel、Seraph、Tharshis、Cherub。…畫得對嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「写在上下和左右的是掌管风火水土的天使们的名字。Chasan、Arel、Taliahad，还有 Phorlakh。而写在四个斜角上的是四大统治者们的名字。Ariel、Seraph、Tharshis、Cherub。…画得对吗？」
Italian (IT): "In alto e in basso, e a destra e a sinistra, ci sono i nomi degli angeli che governano vento, fuoco, terra e acqua. Chasan, Arel, Talihad, e Phorlakh.{n}E nei quattro angoli, ci sono i nomi inclinati dei signori dei quattro elementi.{n}Ariel, Seraph, Tharshis, e Cherub... Corrispondono?"
Turkish (TR): "Haçın dört kolunda hava, ateş, su ve toprağa hükmeden meleklerin isimleri yazılıdır. Chasan, Arel, Talihad ve Phorlakh. Ve dört çapraz yönde dört büyük hükümdarın isimleri yer alır. Ariel, Seraph, Tharshis, Cherub. ...Eşleşiyorlar mı?"

Umineko Project (UP): Even if you are unable to correctly write what you have seen, ...if you are once again shown something identical, it isn't difficult to state that the two are the same.
Steam (ST): Even if they hadn't been able to correctly write what they'd seen, ...when they were once again shown something identical, it wasn't difficult for them to realize the two were the same.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Umineko Project (UP): "It's a magic circle to borrow the power of the sun. ......He who wears it as a talisman drawn in gold shall receive the power to break free from the bonds of any prison, and gain freedom."
Steam (ST): "It's a magic circle to borrow the power of the sun. ......He who wears it as a talisman drawn in gold shall be able to break free from the bonds of any prison and receive the power to gain freedom."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It's a magic circle to borrow the power of the sun. ......He who wears it as a talisman drawn in gold shall be able to break free from the bonds of any prison, and receive the power to gain freedom."
PC Japanese (JP): 「太陽の力を借りる魔法陣だよ。……黄金で描き護符にして身につけたる者は、いかなる牢獄であろうとも束縛から逃れ、自由を得られる力を授けられる。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「太陽の力を借りる魔法陣だよ。……黄金で描き護符にして身につけたる者は、いかなる牢獄であろうとも束縛から逃れ、自由を得られる力を授けられる」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É um círculo mágico para pegar emprestado o poder do Sol. ......Aquele que o veste como um talismã inscrito em ouro receberá o poder de quebrar as correntes de qualquer prisão e ganhar a liberdade."

Italian (IT): "È un pentacolo che attinge il potere del Sole... Chi lo porterà su un talismano forgiato in oro, riceverà il potere di svincolarsi dalle catene di qualsiasi prigione, e di ottenere la libertà."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Umineko Project (UP): "The word "bonds" is not limited in its interpretation to some kind of physical object. ...Therefore it does not only hold meaning for people locked up in an actual jail. It can also refer to the release from mental bonds such as ties of obligation and inescapable fate."
Steam (ST): "The word "bonds" is not limited in its interpretation to some kind of physical object. ...Therefore, it does not only hold meaning for people locked up in an actual jail. It can also refer to the release from mental bonds such as ties of obligation and inescapable fate."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The word 'bonds' is not limited in its interpretation to some kind of physical object. ...Therefore it does not only hold meaning for people locked up in an actual jail. It can also refer to the release from mental bonds such as ties of obligation and inescapable fate."
PC Japanese (JP): 「この束縛という意味は、何も肉体的なものだけを指さないと解釈されている。…だから、縛られて牢屋にいる人ばかりに意味があるわけじゃないよ。しがらみや逃れ得ぬ運命など、精神的な束縛からの解放も意味してるんだよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「この束縛という意味は、何も肉体的なものだけを指さないと解釈されている。…だから、縛られて牢屋にいる人ばかりに意味があるわけじゃないよ。しがらみや逃れ得ぬ運命など、精神的な束縛からの解放も意味してるんだよ」
Russian (RU): "Слово 'узы' в своей интерпретации не ограничивается лишь материальными объектами. ...А следовательно, оно подразумевает не только людей, заключённых в тюрьму. Оно также может относиться к избавлению от уз духовных, таких как узы долга и неминуемого рока."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A palavra "correntes" não é limitada apenas à interpretação de algum objeto físico. ...Portanto, não se refere apenas a pessoas que estão realmente presas. Também pode se referir a se libertar mentalmente de restrições, como vínculos de obrigações e de um destino inescapável."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這個束縛的意思，按這句話來理解的話，並不只是指肉體上的。…所以，它並不光是指被捆在牢房裡的人。也有從挫折或逃不脫的命運之類的，精神上的束縛中解放的意思。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这个束缚的意思，按这句话来理解的话，并不只是指肉体上的。…所以，它并不光是指被捆在牢房里的人。也有从挫折或逃不脱的命运之类的，精神上的束缚中解放的意思。」
Italian (IT): "Il termine ‘catene’ non va interpretato unicamente in senso materiale...{n}Perciò non è rivolto solo a persone rinchiuse in una prigione. Può anche riferirsi a catene spirituali, come i vincoli mentali, o un fato inevitabile."
Turkish (TR): ""Zincirlerinden kurtulmak" durumu bir tür fiziksel nesne ile sınırlı değildir. ...Bu nedenle yalnızca gerçek bir hapishaneye kapatılmış kişilere yönelik bir anlam ifade etmez. Aynı zamanda sorumluluk zincirleri ve kaçınılmaz kader gibi zihinsel zincirlerden kurtulmayı da ifade edebilir."

Umineko Project (UP): As I started getting pissed off with a feeling between anger and sadness, I broke from the circle everyone was in and returned once again to the window.

Steam (ST): There was that letter from the witch, {f:5:Beatrice}, that Maria had read aloud at last night's dinner.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That letter from the witch, Beatrice, that Maria had read aloud at last night's dinner.

Umineko Project (UP): ...I feel like ever since that point, we......no, this whole mansion and this whole island...have begun to be drawn into some kind of peculiar world...
Steam (ST): ...Ever since that point, it feels like we've... no, like this whole mansion and this whole island have been getting more and more firmly locked inside some kind of bizarre world...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...After that point, it felt like we had, ...no, like this whole mansion and this whole island had started to become shut up in some kind of mysterious world...
PC Japanese (JP): …あの時から俺たちは、…いや、この屋敷やこの島が、何か奇妙な世界に取り込まれ始めている気がする…。
Russian (RU): ...С того момента начало создаваться впечатление, словно мы...... нет, весь особняк и весь остров, начали увязать в каком‐то мистическом мире...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Sinto como se tudo, a partir daquele momento, nós......não, toda essa mansão e toda essa ilha...começou a ser atraída para algum tipo de mundo peculiar...

Umineko Project (UP): That's right. When I think back on it, that letter was an invitation from the witch.
Steam (ST): That's right. When I think back on it, that letter was an invitation from the witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's right. When I think back on it, that letter was an invitation from the witch.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 没错。现在想来，那封信就是魔女的请帖。

Turkish (TR): Bu doğru. Tekrar düşündüğümde, o mektup cadıdan gelen bir davetiyeydi.

Umineko Project (UP): The ruler of the nighttime island had invited us inhabitants of the day into another world.
Steam (ST): The ruler of the nighttime island had invited us inhabitants of the day into another world.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The ruler of the nighttime island had invited us inhabitants of the day into another world.
PC Japanese (JP): この島の夜の支配者が、昼間の俺たちを、もうひとつの世界へ招待したのだ。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A governante da ilha durante a noite convidou a nós, os habitantes do dia, para o outro mundo.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 这座岛夜间的统治者，把白天的我们，招待进了另一个世界。

Turkish (TR): Gece adasının hakimi biz gündüz sakinlerini başka bir dünyaya davet etmişti.

Umineko Project (UP): With the phone and the radio interrupted, and the island shut off by the typhoon, you could now call it another world cut off from the real one.
Steam (ST): The phone and the radio had been interrupted and the island was shut off by the typhoon, so you really could call this place another world cut off from the real one by now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The phone and the radio had been interrupted, the island was shut off by the typhoon, you could now call it another world cut off from the real one.
PC Japanese (JP): 電話も無線も途絶し、台風に閉ざされたこの島は、今や切り取られた異世界とすら言い切れる。
Russian (RU): Телефон и радиосвязь не работали, тогда как сам остров был отрезан ураганом; теперь его можно назвать иным миром, изолированным от настоящего.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我甚至可以斷言，電話和無線電都不通，被台風封閉著的這座島，現在是個被切離開來的異世界。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........So what will happen next? Will some weird people wearing goat masks start doing the Bon Festival dance or something...?!

Umineko Project (UP): ...Aah, it's no good, it's no good, I don't get it...{n}The inside of my head's all screwed up, and I don't even know what to think...
Steam (ST): ...Aah, it's hopeless, it's hopeless, I don't get it... The inside of my head's all screwed up, and I don't even know what to think...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Aah, it's hopeless, it's hopeless, I don't get it... The inside of my head's all screwed up, and I don't even know what to think...
PC Japanese (JP): …あぁ、ダメだダメだ、わけがわかんねぇ…。頭ん中がぐちゃぐちゃで、何を考えればいいのかもわかんねぇ…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …あぁ、ダメだダメだ、わけがわかんねぇ…。{n}頭ん中がぐちゃぐちゃで、何を考えればいいのかもわかんねぇ…。

Umineko Project (UP): Anger, sadness.{n}The opposing emotions all swirled up together, and they started to suck me in.
Steam (ST): Anger, sadness. The opposing emotions all swirled up together, and they started to suck me in.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Anger, sadness. The opposing emotions all swirled up together, and they started to suck me in.
PC Japanese (JP): 怒り、悲しみ。相反する感情が渦を巻き、俺を飲み込んでいく。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 怒り、悲しみ。{n}相反する感情が渦を巻き、俺を飲み込んでいく。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Raiva, tristeza.{n}As emoções opostas se agitam num turbilhão dentro de mim, me sugando para dentro dele.

Umineko Project (UP): Unable to resist, ...I could do nothing but cover my eyes with my hands and entrust my mind and body to the spiral swallowing me.........
Steam (ST): Unable to resist, ...I could do nothing but cover my eyes with my hands and trust to my mind and body as I started getting sucked in......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Unable to resist, ...I could do nothing but cover my eyes with my hands and trust to my mind and body as I started getting sucked in.........
PC Japanese (JP): 俺は抗うこともできず、…こうして両目を手で覆って飲み込まれていくに身と心を任せるだけだ………。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Incapaz de resistir, ...eu não posso fazer nada além de cobrir meus olhos com as mãos e confiar meu corpo e mente à espiral que me consome.........

Umineko Project (UP): It was from when I was very young.

Umineko Project (UP): I had unfortunately seen a scary occult movie on TV, and for a while, I hadn't even been able to go to the bathroom by myself.
Steam (ST): I had unfortunately seen a scary occult movie on TV, and for a while, I hadn't even been able to go to the bathroom by myself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I had unfortunately seen a scary occult movie on TV, and for a while, I hadn't even been able to go to the bathroom by myself.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu tive a infelicidade de ver um filme assustador de ocultismo na TV e, por algum tempo, eu não fui capaz de ir ao banheiro sozinho.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): ......Hey, Battler. Why do you think they go to all of the trouble to make movies like this about demons and the occult and such?
Steam (ST): ......Hey, Battler. Why do you think they go to all the trouble to make movies like this about demons and the occult and such?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Hey, Battler. Why do you think they go to all of the trouble to make movies like this about demons and the occult and such?

Turkish (TR): ......Hey, Battler. Neden iblisler, okültizm ve benzeri konularda böyle filmler yapmak için bu kadar zahmete giriyorlar sanıyorsun?

Umineko Project (UP): It's 'cause they don't exist. ...Something that ridiculous can't be found anywhere on the planet.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É porque isso não existe. ...Algo ridículo assim não pode ser encontrado em nenhum canto do planeta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是因為沒有呀。…地球上的哪裡都不會有這種滑稽的東西。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是因为没有呀。…地球上的哪里都不会有这种滑稽的东西。

Turkish (TR): Çünkü böyle şeyler gerçek değil. ...Bu kadar saçma şeyler gezegenin hiçbir yerinde yok.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): 'Cause they don't exist, people want to see them and go to a lot of effort making them. That's why those occult movies just make me laugh.
Steam (ST): Because they don't exist, people want to see them and go to a lot of effort making them. That's why those occult movies just make me laugh.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because they don't exist, people want to see them and go to a lot of effort making them. That's why those occult movies just make me laugh.
PC Japanese (JP): ねぇから、わざわざ見たくて作るんだよ。だから俺はオカルト映画なんて、ちゃんちゃら可笑しくて笑っちまうってんだ。
Russian (RU): «И потому, что их не существует, люди хотят их видеть и прилагают много усилий, чтобы их создать. Вот почему все эти оккультные фильмы вызывают у меня только смех.»
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É porque isso não existe que as pessoas querem ver, e se esforçam para criar.{n}Por isso que esses filmes só conseguem me fazer rir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為沒有，所以才想看看，才專門做成電影的。所以那些神秘學類的電影什麼的，會滑稽荒誕得讓我笑出聲來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为没有，所以才想看看，才专门做成电影的。所以那些神秘学类的电影什么的，会滑稽荒诞得让我笑出声来。
Italian (IT): E siccome non esistono, la gente vuole guardarle, e si dà da fare per crearle.{n}Ecco perché questi film sull'occulto mi fanno schiattare dalle risate.
Turkish (TR): Var olmadıkları için insanlar onları görmeyi istiyor ve onları yapmak için de çok çaba sarf ediyorlar. Bu yüzden o okült filmler beni güldürüyor.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): If you ask me, rather than demons and monsters, this year's earnings call and angry wives are a hundred million times scarier.
Steam (ST): If I were forced to choose, I'd say, rather than demons and monsters, this year's earnings call and angry wives are 100 million times scarier.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If I were forced to choose, I'd say, rather than demons and monsters, this year's earnings call and angry wives are 100 million times scarier.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺に言わせりゃ、悪魔やら妖怪やらより、今年度の収支報告や、機嫌を悪くした女房の方が一億倍も怖ぇってもんだぜ。
Russian (RU): «По мне, так требуемый уровень дохода в этом году и разозлённые жёны будут в сто миллионов раз страшнее всяких демонов и монстров.»
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se você me perguntar, acima de demônio e monstros, os lucros deste ano e esposas irritadas são cem milhões de vezes mais assustadores.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要我說，比起惡魔啊妖怪啊，本年度的收支報告和心情不好的老婆，要恐怖一億倍。

Italian (IT): Se vuoi sentire la mia, più che i demoni o i mostri, sono miliardi di volte più spaventosi i resoconti finanziari annuali e le mogli di malumore.
Turkish (TR): Bana soracak olursan, şeytanlar ve canavarlardan ziyade, bu yılki kazanç görüşmeleri ve kızgın eşim yüz milyon kat daha korkutucu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): I'll go further, alright? If you ask me...being scared is an emotion for the entertainment of people who have too much time on their hands and too much empty space in their minds.
Steam (ST): I'll go further, okay? From my point of view... Getting scared is a recreational emotion, something for people who've got room to relax both in their hearts and their lifestyles.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'll go further, alright? If you force me to. What you're scared of is something made to entertain people who have too much time on their hands and too much empty space in their minds.
PC Japanese (JP): さらに言うぜ？　俺に言わせりゃな。怖がるってのは、心と生活にゆとりのある連中の娯楽的感情なのさ。
Russian (RU): «Я продолжу, ладно? Раз уж ты меня спрашиваешь... Предметом твоей боязни является продукт, созданный для развлечения людей, которым некуда девать своё свободное время, и у которых в голове ветер свищет.»
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E digo mais, certo? Se você me perguntar...assustar‐se é uma emoção para o entretenimento de pessoas que têm muito tempo livre e muito espaço vazio na cabeça.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 再說得徹底點，要我說啊。所謂恐懼，是那些內心和生活都優哉游哉的傢伙們用來取樂的感情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 再说得彻底点，要我说啊。所谓恐惧，是那些内心和生活都优哉游哉的家伙们用来取乐的感情。
Italian (IT): E ti dirò di più, ok? Dal mio punto di vista... Quello di cui hai paura è stato creato per intrattenere tizi che hanno vuoto nella loro zucca e nella loro vita.
Turkish (TR): Daha da ileri gideceğim. Bana göre...korkmak, elinde çok fazla boş zamanı ve zihninde çok fazla boş alanı olan insanların eğlenmesi için olan bir duygudur.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): They have so much free time they don't know what to do with it, so in order to play around with unusual emotions, they created a culture of demons and monsters and stuff.
Steam (ST): They had so much free time, they didn't know what to do with it, so in order to entertain their mind with unusual emotions, people started creating a culture with demons and the occult and stuff.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They have so much free time, they don't know what to do with it, so in order to play around with their unusual emotions, they created a culture of demons and monsters and stuff.
PC Japanese (JP): 暇で暇でしょうがないから、連中は変わった感情で心を遊ばせたくて、悪魔だのオカルトだのって文化を作り出したんだよ。
Russian (RU): «У них столько свободного времени, что они даже не знают, на что его потратить, и для того, чтобы манипулировать необычными эмоциями, они создали культуру демонов, монстров и иже с ними.»
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas têm tanto tempo livre que não sabem o que fazer com ele, então para brincar com essas emoções incomuns, elas criaram uma cultura sobre demônios, monstros e outras coisas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為閑得不得了，這些傢伙們就想用不一樣的感情讓內心爽一把，所以才創造出了惡魔啊神秘學啊之類的文化。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为闲得不得了，这些家伙们就想用不一样的感情让内心爽一把，所以才创造出了恶魔啊神秘学啊之类的文化。
Italian (IT): Dato che hanno fin troppo tempo libero, vogliono sperimentare emozioni nuove, e così hanno cominciato a creare una cultura basata sui demoni e sull'occultismo.
Turkish (TR): O kadar çok boş zamanları var ki, bununla ne yapacaklarını bilmiyorlar, ve bu yüzden bu alışılmadık duygularla eğlenmek için iblisler ve canavarlar kültürünü yarattılar.

Umineko Project (UP): .............................................{n}......Seriously, why have I been acting so damn thickheaded.{n}I was totally taken in.
Steam (ST): ..................... ...Seriously, why have I been acting so damn thickheaded? I was totally taken in.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ..............................Seriously, why have I been acting so damn thickheaded. I was totally taken in.
PC Japanese (JP): ………………………………………。……まったくだぜ、俺は何をぼんやりしてやがったんだ。すっかりヤラれちまってたぜ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ………………………………………。{n}……まったくだぜ、俺は何をぼんやりしてやがったんだ。{n}すっかりヤラれちまってたぜ。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .............................................{n}......Sério, por que eu estava sendo tão estúpido?{n}Eu fui completamente envolvido.

Russian (RU): .........Не пытайтесь играть со мной, это мир людей.{n}Плевать мне на ведьм, демонов, магические круги и жертвы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Pro caralho com essa merda, este é o mundo humano.{n}Como se eu me importasse com bruxas, demônios, círculos mágicos e sacrifícios.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): The human who killed Dad and everyone else is still on this island. That's all there is, right...?!

Umineko Project (UP): Next to start speaking to my heart was Kyrie‐san.
Steam (ST): The next person who started speaking to my heart was Kyrie-san.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The next thing that started speaking to my heart was Kyrie-san.
PC Japanese (JP): 次に俺の心に語り掛けてきたのは霧江さんだった。

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 緊接著向我的內心搭話的是霧江姐。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 紧接着向我的内心搭话的是雾江姐。
Italian (IT): Subito dopo, Kirie-san mi parlò dentro la mia mente.
Turkish (TR): Kalbimle konuşmaya başlayan bir sonraki kişi Kyrie-san'dı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Umineko Project (UP): You know, in chess and shogi...the deeper you proceed into the mating attack, the very last moment of the endgame, the more limited your best possible moves become.
Steam (ST): You see, in both chess and Shogi... When you reach the very, very last stage of the game and get closer and closer to cornering your opponent, the number of optimal moves you could possibly make gets smaller and smaller.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): You're talking about chess and Shogi, right? In the last part of the last part of the game, when you proceed to the final stage and everything becomes more and more closed in, the best possible moves start to become limited.
PC Japanese (JP): チェスや将棋ってね？終盤の終盤、詰めの最後の段階に入れば入るほど、最善手は限られてくるのよ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): チェスや将棋ってね？　終盤の終盤、詰めの最後の段階に入れば入るほど、最善手は限られてくるのよ。
Russian (RU): «Знаешь, в шахматах и сёги... когда партия переходит в эндшпиль, и ты достиг финальной стадии игры, то снижается и количество лучших возможных ходов.»
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Você sabia, no xadrez e no shogi...quanto mais você progride rumo ao ataque, no momento do final do jogo, mais limitadas ficam suas melhores opções de movimento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 國際象棋和將棋呢，在終盤的終盤，越是進入步步緊逼的最後階段，越難下出最妙的一手棋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 国际象棋和将棋呢，在终盘的终盘，越是进入步步紧逼的最后阶段，越难下出最妙的一手棋。
Italian (IT): Vedi? Negli scacchi e nello shogi... Quando raggiungi l'ultimissima fase di gioco, man mano che avanzerai verso lo stadio finale, il numero di mosse efficienti che potrai effettuare si restringerà...
Turkish (TR): Biliyorsun, satrançta ve shogi'de...mat saldırısında ne kadar ileri gidilirse, oyunun son anına gelindiğinde, olası en iyi hamleler de o kadar sınırlı hale gelir.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Umineko Project (UP): ......Therefore, in that very moment when you're backing someone against the wall, or someone is doing the same to you, both players' moves become infinitely easier to read.
Steam (ST): ...Therefore, if you're backing someone against the wall, or if someone's doing the same to you, both players' moves become infinitely easier to read.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Therefore, if you're backing someone against the wall, or someone is doing the same to you, both players' moves become infinitely easier to read.
PC Japanese (JP): ……だから、自分が追い詰めている、あるいは追い詰められているというその時、両者の手は限りなく読みやすくなるのよ。
Russian (RU): «......Таким образом, если ты загоняешь кого‐нибудь в угол, или кто‐то проделывает то же самое с тобой, то ходы обоих игроков становится гораздо легче просчитать.»
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Entretanto, no momento em que você está colocando alguém contra a parede, ou alguém está fazendo o mesmo que você, os movimentos de ambos os jogadores se tornam infinitamente mais fáceis de serem lidos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……所以，自己在緊逼對方，又或者是被對方緊逼時，雙方的下一步都是極其容易猜到的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……所以，自己在紧逼对方，又或者是被对方紧逼时，双方的下一步都是极其容易猜到的。
Italian (IT): Di conseguenza, se stai mettendo qualcuno con le spalle al muro, o se qualcuno sta facendo lo stesso con te, le mosse di entrambi i giocatori saranno molto più facili da prevedere.
Turkish (TR): ......Bu nedenle, birini duvara yasladığın, ya da birinin sana aynısını yaptığı o anda, her iki oyuncunun da hamlelerini okumak son derece kolaylaşır.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Umineko Project (UP): In other words, when you are completely cornered and you think you have no moves left, that is the moment when it is easiest to read your opponent.
Steam (ST): In other words, when you're completely cornered and you think you have no moves left, that is the moment when it's easiest to read your opponent.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, when you are completely cornered and you think you have no moves left, that is the moment when it is easiest to read your opponent.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、完全に追い詰められて打つ手なしって思ったその時こそ、もっとも読みやすい瞬間なのよ。
Russian (RU): «Другими словами, когда тебя практически загнали в угол, и ты думаешь, что у тебя не осталось никаких ходов, то это и есть тот самый момент, когда проще всего просчитать ходы своего оппонента.»
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, quando você está completamente encurralado e pensa no tempo que ainda resta, esse é o momento mais fácil para você ler o seu oponente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，你覺得被完全逼上絕路，束手無策的時候，正是最容易猜到對手會怎麼做的瞬間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，你觉得被完全逼上绝路，束手无策的时候，正是最容易猜到对手会怎么做的瞬间。
Italian (IT): In altre parole, quando sei completamente circondato, e pensi di non avere nulla a tua disposizione, è il momento in cui capire il tuo avversario sarà più facile...
Turkish (TR): Başka bir deyişle, tamamen köşeye sıkıştırıldığında ve hiçbir hamlenin kalmadığını düşündüğünde, işte o an rakibini okumanın en kolay olduğu andır.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Umineko Project (UP): ......However, when a person is forced into a defensive position, they can't help but lose their ability to think clearly, so they forget to read their opponent's moves.
Steam (ST): ...However, when a person is forced into a defensive position, they can't help but lose their ability to think clearly, so they aren't able to get their minds around their opponent's moves.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......However, when a person is forced into a defensive position, they can't help but lose their ability to think clearly, so they aren't able to get their minds around their opponent's moves.
PC Japanese (JP): ……でも、守勢に立った人間はどうしても考えが硬くなって相手の手を読むことにまで考えが至らない。
Russian (RU): «......Однако когда человек вынужден обороняться, то не может ничего поделать, кроме как потерять способность ясно мыслить, из‐за чего он становится негодным к размышлению над ходами своего оппонента.»
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......No entanto, quando uma pessoa é forçada a ficar na posição defensiva, ela não pode fazer nada além de perder a habilidade de pensar claramente e acaba esquecendo de ler os movimentos do oponente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……但是，處於守勢的人，思路總是會變得僵硬，想不到去猜對方會怎麼下。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但是，处于守势的人，思路总是会变得僵硬，想不到去猜对方会怎么下。
Italian (IT): Tuttavia, una persona che si trova sulla difensiva ragiona in maniera meno flessibile, e non è in grado di analizzare le mosse dell'avversario...
Turkish (TR): ......Ancak, bir kişi savunma pozisyonuna zorlandığında, net düşünme yeteneğini kaybetmekten başka bir şey yapamaz, bu nedenle rakibinin hamlelerini okumayı unutur.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Umineko Project (UP): ......That's when...you "flip over the chessboard".
Steam (ST): ......That's when you "spin the chessboard around".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......That's when you 'turn the chessboard over'.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そういう時はね、“チェス盤をひっくり返す”の。
Russian (RU): «......Вот именно тогда... и следует "развернуть шахматную доску".»
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......É quando...você "vira o tabuleiro".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這種時候呢，就要把“國際象棋盤翻轉過來”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这种时候呢，就要把“国际象棋盘翻转过来”。
Italian (IT): Ed è in momenti come questi, che bisogna ‘rigirare la scacchiera’.
Turkish (TR): ......İşte o zaman..."satranç tahtasını ters çevirirsin".

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 俺は勢い良く、両手で自分の頬を叩く。{n}………すっかり目が覚めた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com toda a minha força, eu bati no meu rosto com as duas mãos.{n}.........Agora, meus olhos estão completamente abertos.
