Chinese Simplified (CN): 我猛烈地用双手拍了下自己的脸颊。{n}………我完全清醒了。
Italian (IT): Mi schiaffai con forza entrambe le mani sulle guance... Vedevo tutto con chiarezza.
Turkish (TR): İki elimle tüm gücümle yüzümü tokatladım.{n}.........Şimdi gözlerim gerçekten açılmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): When you don't understand anything, and you're completely cornered just like I am now, isn't that the perfect time to "flip over the chessboard"...!
Steam (ST): When you don't understand anything, and you're completely cornered just like I am now, isn't that the perfect time to "spin the chessboard around"...?!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When you don't understand anything, and you are completely cornered just like I was then, isn't that the perfect time to 'turn the chessboard over'...!
PC Japanese (JP): さっぱりわからねぇと、完璧に追い詰められた今こそが“チェス盤をひっくり返す”タイミングじゃねぇのか…！
Russian (RU): Когда ты ничего не понимаешь и полностью загнан в угол, совсем как я недавно, разве это не идеальное время, чтобы "развернуть шахматную доску"!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando você não entende nada e fica completamente encurralado, assim como agora, é o momento perfeito para "virar o tabuleiro"...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 什麼都搞不懂，完全被逼上絕路的現在，不正是把“國際象棋盤翻轉過來”的時機嗎…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 什么都搞不懂，完全被逼上绝路的现在，不正是把“国际象棋盘翻转过来”的时机吗…！
Italian (IT): Quando non si capisce più niente, e si è completamente circondati, è il momento perfetto per ‘rigirare la scacchiera’...!
Turkish (TR): Hiçbir şey anlamadığınızda ve tıpkı benim şu anda olduğum gibi tamamen köşeye sıkıştığınızda, "satranç tahtasını ters çevirmek" için mükemmel bir zaman değil mi...!

Umineko Project (UP): With us put on the defensive, we couldn't even guess at the culprit's scheme.
Steam (ST): While on the defensive, we can't even guess at the culprit's scheme.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 守勢に立った俺たちには、犯人の目論見はさっぱり見当が付かない。
Russian (RU): Будучи вынужденными занять обороняющуюся позицию, мы не могли даже представить план преступника.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Empurrados para a defensiva, nós não tínhamos como sequer tentar adivinhar o esquema do culpado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 處於守勢的我們，對犯人的意圖沒一點頭緒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 处于守势的我们，对犯人的意图没一点头绪。
Italian (IT): Mettendoci sulla difensiva, non saremo mai riusciti a dedurre i piani del colpevole...
Turkish (TR): Savunmaya çekildiğimizde, suçlunun planını tahmin bile edemezdik.

Umineko Project (UP): ...If you flipped it over and looked at it the other way, just how far could you see?
Steam (ST): ...If we spin it around and look at it that way, just what might we see?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...If you turned it over and looked at it that way, just how far could you see?
PC Japanese (JP): …ひっくり返して見てみたら、一体何が見えるのか。
Russian (RU): ...Если ты развернёшь всё и посмотришь на ситуацию с другой стороны, то насколько расширится твой обзор?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Se você virar o tabuleiro e olhar por outra perspectiva, o quão longe você conseguiria ver?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …那麼翻轉過來看一下的話，究竟能看到什麼呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): …那么翻转过来看一下的话，究竟能看到什么呢？
Italian (IT): Se avessimo guardato la scacchiera rigirata, che cosa diamine saremo riuciti a vedere...?
Turkish (TR): ...Eğer ters çevirip diğer taraftan baksaydınız, ne kadar uzağı görebilirdiniz?

Umineko Project (UP): ......First off, at the time the murders were committed by the culprit, they knew that the island was cut off by the typhoon.
Steam (ST): ...First off, at the time the culprit committed the murders, they knew the island was being cut off by the typhoon.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……まず、犯人は殺人を犯す時点で、島が台風に閉ざされているのを知っていた。
Russian (RU): ......Перво‐наперво, когда совершалось преступление, то преступники знали, что остров был отрезан бурей от остального мира.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Primeiramente, no momento em que o culpado cometeu o crime, ele já sabia que a ilha iria ficar isolada por causa do tufão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……首先，犯人在殺人時，就知道這座島被台風封閉著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……首先，犯人在杀人时，就知道这座岛被台风封闭着。
Italian (IT): Per prima cosa, il colpevole sapeva che, quando avrebbe compiuto gli omicidi, l'isola sarebbe stata isolata dal tifone.
Turkish (TR): ......Öncelikle, cinayetlerin işlendiği sırada suçlular adanın tayfun tarafından kapatıldığını biliyorlardı.

Umineko Project (UP): So, they should have understood that even if they carried out the murders, they wouldn't be able to get away until the next morning.
Steam (ST): Therefore, they should've understood that even if they carried out the murders, they wouldn't be able to get away early the next morning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Therefore, they should have understood that even if they carried out the murders, they wouldn't be able to get away until the next morning.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、殺人を実行しても翌朝にすぐ逃げられるわけではないことも理解していたはず。
Russian (RU): А значит, они должны были понимать, что даже если они совершат преступление, то не смогут скрыться до следующего утра.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ele deve ter entendido que mesmo cometendo os assassinatos, não teria como escapar até a manhã seguinte.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，他應該也知道殺了人後，不可能在第二天早上馬上逃出去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，他应该也知道杀了人后，不可能在第二天早上马上逃出去。
Italian (IT): Pertanto, doveva essere a conoscenza del fatto che, anche se fosse riuscito a compiere gli omicidi, non avrebbe potuto scappare fino al mattino seguente.
Turkish (TR): Dolayısıyla, cinayetleri işleseler bile ertesi sabaha kadar kaçamayacaklarını anlamış olmaları gerekirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): In short, the culprit had begun without securing a way to escape.
Steam (ST): In short, the culprit had begun without securing a way to escape.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In short, the culprit had begun without securing a way to escape.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、犯人は退路の確保もなく殺人に踏み切ったわけだ。
Russian (RU): Короче говоря, преступник начал действовать, не приготовив путь для отхода.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Resumindo, o culpado começou isso sem ter a segurança de que poderia escapar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，犯人是在沒有保證退路的情況下，就下定了殺人的決心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，犯人是在没有保证退路的情况下，就下定了杀人的决心。
Italian (IT): In breve, il colpevole aveva effettuato gli omicidi senza essersi assicurato una via di fuga.
Turkish (TR): Kısacası, suçlu kaçmak için bir yol bulamadan işe başlamıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): Furthermore, the bastard had even tossed the corpses in the storehouse, while doing the courtesy of telling us "They are here" with that weird graffiti.
Steam (ST): Furthermore, that bastard tossed the corpses in the storehouse, then was even kind enough to say "Here they are!" with that weird bit of graffiti.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Furthermore, that bastard had tossed the corpses in the storehouse, almost like they were politely telling us 'They are here' with that weird scribble.
PC Japanese (JP): しかもその死体は倉庫にぶち込み、ご丁寧にも、ここにありますよと妙な落書きでアピールまでしてくれやがった。
Russian (RU): Кроме того, этот ублюдок бросил тела в кладовой, а той мазнёй на подъёмной двери словно вежливо сообщил: "Они здесь".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além disso, o maldito tinha atirado os corpos no depósito, enquanto nos oferecia a cortesia de nos dizer "Eles estão aqui" com aquela pichação estranha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且他還把屍體扔進倉庫，甚至費心地為我們留下了奇怪的塗鴉，告訴我們“就在這裡哦”，以此吸引我們的注意。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且他还把尸体扔进仓库，甚至费心地为我们留下了奇怪的涂鸦，告诉我们“就在这里哦”，以此吸引我们的注意。
Italian (IT): E ammassando i corpi nel magazzino, era stato così cortese da attirare la nostra attenzione con quello strano graffito, come a dirci: ‘sono qui!’.
Turkish (TR): Dahası, piç kurusu cesetleri ambara bile atmış, bir yandan da o tuhaf duvar yazısıyla bize "Buradalar" deme nezaketini göstermişti.

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, since we would probably find the corpses sooner or later, they wanted to "show us them".
Steam (ST): In other words, since we'd probably find the corpses sooner or later, they "wanted to show them to us".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, since we would probably find the corpses sooner or later, they 'wanted to show us them'.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、やがて死体を見つけるだろう俺たちに“見せたい”のだ。
Russian (RU): Другим словами, так как мы, скорее всего, рано или поздно нашли бы трупы, то они хотели нам их показать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, já que íamos encontrar os cadáveres, cedo ou tarde, ele quis "mostrá‐los para nós".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，他“想展示”給遲早會找到屍體的我們看。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，他“想展示”给迟早会找到尸体的我们看。
Italian (IT): In altre parole, siccome presto o tardi avremmo trovato i cadaveri, lui {i:voleva mostrarceli}...
Turkish (TR): Başka bir deyişle, cesetleri er ya da geç bulacağımız için "bize göstermek" istediler.

Umineko Project (UP): ......If we had all been dim, and hadn't noticed the storage shed, perhaps the culprit's goal "would not have been achieved"?
Steam (ST): ......If we'd all been dim... and hadn't noticed the storage shed, the culprit's goal "would not have been achieved", would it?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......If we had all been dim and hadn't noticed the storage shed, the culprit's goal 'would not have been achieved', would it?
PC Japanese (JP): ……もし俺たちが全員トボけていて、あの倉庫に気付かなかったら、犯人の目的は“達せられていなかったのではないか”。
Russian (RU): ......А окажись мы бестолковыми, не обрати внимания на склад, то цель преступника не была бы достигнута, не так ли?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Se nós tivéssemos ficado no escuro, sem perceber o incidente no depósito, talvez o objetivo do culpado "não tivesse sido alcançado"?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……如果我們全糊塗了，沒有注意到那個倉庫的話，那犯人的目的“不就沒能達成嗎”？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……如果我们全糊涂了，没有注意到那个仓库的话，那犯人的目的“不就没能达成吗”？
Italian (IT): Se fossimo stati tutti dei grandi idioti... e non avessimo notato il magazzino, l'obiettivo del colpevole non sarebbe stato {i:raggiunto}, vero?
Turkish (TR): ......Hepimiz sersem olsaydık, ve ambarı fark etmeseydik, belki de suçlu "amacına ulaşamayacak" mıydı?

Umineko Project (UP): Hehe, if you think about it this way, that murdering maniac...{n}Since this morning, he must have been watching our every move with bated breath.
Steam (ST): Hehe, if you think about it this way, that bastard of a culprit... Since this morning, they must've been watching our every move with bated breath.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Hehe, if you think about it this way, that bastard of a culprit... Since this morning, he must have been watching our every move with bated breath.
PC Japanese (JP): へへ、こう考えてくると、犯人のやつめ。朝からの俺たちの動きにハラハラしてやがっただろうよ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): へへ、こう考えてくると、犯人のやつめ。{n}朝からの俺たちの動きにハラハラしてやがっただろうよ。
Russian (RU): Хе‐хе, если представить всё так, то этот преступник — ещё та сволочь...{n}Он, должно быть, с самого утра следил за каждым нашим движением, затаив дыхание.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Hehe, se você pensar desta forma, esse maníaco homicida...{n}Desde esta manhã, ele deve estar observando cada um de nossos movimentos com a respiração suspensa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嘿嘿，這麼一想，犯人那傢伙。{n}從一大早就在為我們的行動捏一把汗吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘿嘿，这么一想，犯人那家伙。{n}从一大早就在为我们的行动捏一把汗吧。
Italian (IT): Eheh, a vederla così, il colpevole era un gran bastardo. Fin da stamattina, stava osservando ogni nostro spostamento col fiato sospeso.
Turkish (TR): Hehe, eğer bu şekilde düşünürseniz, o manyak katil...{n}Sabahtan beri her hareketimizi nefesini tutarak izliyor olmalı.

Umineko Project (UP): After all, if we hadn't been so kind as to discover what was on the storehouse, all of that hard work and preparation that they had done last night would have just gone "poof".
Steam (ST): After all, if we hadn't been so kind as to discover what was on the storehouse, all of that hard work and preparation they did last night would've just gone "poof".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After all, if we hadn't been so kind as to discover what was on the storehouse, all of that hard work and preparation that they had done last night would have just gone 'poof'.
PC Japanese (JP): 何しろ、あの倉庫を見つけてくれなかったら、昨晩、さんざん苦労して準備したものがパーになるところだったんだからなぁ。
Russian (RU): В конце концов если бы мы не оказались столь любезны обнаружить то, что лежало в кладовой, все их приготовления прошлой ночью пошли бы коту под хвост.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Afinal, se não tivéssemos sido gentis descobrindo o que estava dentro do depósito, todo o trabalho duro e preparações que ele fez na noite passada simplesmente acabariam em um "poof".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 畢竟，要是我們沒找到那個倉庫的話，昨晚大費周張辛苦準備的一切，就全都要打水漂了啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 毕竟，要是我们没找到那个仓库的话，昨晚大费周张辛苦准备的一切，就全都要打水漂了啊。
Italian (IT): Dopotutto, se non gli avessimo fatto il favore di scoprire cosa ci fosse nel magazzino, tutta la fatica ed i preparativi della notte scorsa sarebbero andati in fumo.
Turkish (TR): Sonuçta, ambarda ne olduğunu keşfedecek kadar nazik olmasaydık, dün gece yaptıkları tüm o sıkı çalışma ve hazırlık bir anda "puf" olup gidecekti.

Umineko Project (UP): What did the culprit want to make us feel by showing us the corpses in the storehouse?
Steam (ST): What did the culprit want to make us feel by showing us the corpses in the storehouse?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): What did the culprit want to make us feel by showing us the corpses in the storehouse?
PC Japanese (JP): 犯人は、倉庫の死体を見せて俺たちに何を感じさせたいんだ？
Russian (RU): Что преступник хотел заставить нас почувствовать, показав нам трупы в кладовой?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O que o culpado queria que sentíssemos nos mostrando os corpos no depósito?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 犯人把倉庫的屍體展示給我們，是想讓我們感受到什麼呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 犯人把仓库的尸体展示给我们，是想让我们感受到什么呢？
Italian (IT): Cosa voleva farci provare il colpevole, mostrandoci i cadaveri nel magazzino?
Turkish (TR): Suçlu bize ambardaki cesetleri göstererek ne hissettirmek istiyordu?

Umineko Project (UP): All six of the bodies had had their faces noticeably destroyed.{n}...A grudge? A warning?
Steam (ST): All six of the bodies had their faces noticeably destroyed. ...Was it a grudge? A warning?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): All six of the bodies had had their faces noticeably destroyed....A grudge? A warning?
PC Japanese (JP): ６人の遺体はみな顔面を著しく破壊されていた。…怨恨？　見せしめ？
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ６人の遺体はみな顔面を著しく破壊されていた。{n}…怨恨？　見せしめ？
Russian (RU): Лица всех шести тел были крайне изуродованы.{n}...Обида ли это? Или предупреждение?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos os seis corpos tiveram seus rostos claramente destruídos.{n}...Um rancor? Um aviso?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 六具遺體的面部全被嚴重毀壞。{n}…怨恨？警示？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 六具遗体的面部全被严重毁坏。{n}…怨恨？警示？
Italian (IT): Tutti e sei i corpi avevano il volto visibilmente spappolato... Rancore?{n}Un avvertimento?
Turkish (TR): Altı cesedin de yüzleri gözle görülür şekilde parçalanmıştı.{n}...Bir kin mi? Bir uyarı mı?

Umineko Project (UP): The defacement of the bodies had occurred after death.{n}So it hadn't been the means by which the culprit had murdered.{n}It didn't mean anything to those who had been killed.{n}...It had "meaning to those who discovered it".
Steam (ST): The defacement of the bodies had occurred after death. So it hadn't been the means by which the culprit had killed. It didn't mean anything to those who had been killed. ...It "did have meaning to those who found the bodies".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The defacement of the bodies had occurred after death. So it hadn't been the means by which the culprit had murdered. It didn't mean anything to those who had been killed....It 'did have meaning to those who found the bodies'.
PC Japanese (JP): 遺体の破壊は死後だ。つまり、殺人の手段じゃない。殺した相手への意味じゃない。…それを“発見する者たちへの意味”だ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 遺体の破壊は死後だ。{n}つまり、殺人の手段じゃない。{n}殺した相手への意味じゃない。{n}…それを“発見する者たちへの意味”だ。
Russian (RU): Изуродование лиц было совершено после смерти.{n}Способ, которым преступник совершил убийства, не имел значения.{n}Он также не играл значения для убитых.{n}...Нет, то, как они были убиты, имело значение для тех, кто обнаружил тела.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A desfiguração dos corpos ocorreu depois da morte.{n}Então isso não mostrava os meios pelos quais o culpado os tinha assassinados.{n}Não significava nada para aqueles que foram mortos.{n}...Tinha significado "para aqueles que os descobriram".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 破壞屍體是在死後進行的。{n}也就是說，這並不是殺人的手段。{n}對被殺死的人是沒有意義的。{n}…這個意義是“給發現的人的”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 破坏尸体是在死后进行的。{n}也就是说，这并不是杀人的手段。{n}对被杀死的人是没有意义的。{n}…这个意义是“给发现的人的”。
Italian (IT): Il deturpamento dei cadaveri era avvenuto dopo la loro morte. Quindi non erano stati uccisi in quel modo. Non aveva alcun senso per coloro che erano stati uccisi... Lo aveva {i:per chi li avrebbe trovati}.
Turkish (TR): Cesetlerin parçalanması ölümden sonra gerçekleşmişti.{n}Yani suçlunun öldürme yöntemi bu değildi.{n}Öldürülenler için bir şey ifade etmiyordu.{n}..."Onları keşfedenler için bir anlam" taşıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): The culprit wanted to show them to us—look how brutally I killed them!
Steam (ST): The culprit wanted to make it appear that they had been killed so brutally.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The culprit wanted to make it appear that they had been killed so brutally.
PC Japanese (JP): これだけ惨たらしく殺した、と、俺たちにアピールしたいわけだ。
Russian (RU): Преступник стремился представить всё так, будто те шестеро были жестоко убиты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O culpado queria mostrá‐los para nós — olhem a forma brutal como eu os matei!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 犯人是想向我們炫耀，他的殺人手法是如此殘忍。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 犯人是想向我们炫耀，他的杀人手法是如此残忍。
Italian (IT): Il colpevole voleva farci credere che fossero stati uccisi con estrema brutalità.
Turkish (TR): Suçlu onları bize göstermek istemişti—bakın onları ne kadar vahşice öldürdüm!

Umineko Project (UP): Ha! After thinking this way, I really want to tell that asshole to stop taking me so lightly.
Steam (ST): Ha! After thinking this way, I really wanna tell that bastard to stop taking me so lightly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ha! After thinking this way, I really want to tell that bastard to stop taking me so lightly.
PC Japanese (JP): は！　そう考えてくると、舐めんじゃねぇって気になってくるぜ。
Russian (RU): Ха! После таких размышлений мне очень хочется сказать тому ублюдку перестать недооценивать меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ha! Depois de pensar dessa forma, eu realmente queria dizer ao filho da mãe para parar de me subestimar assim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 哈！這麼一想，還真想賜他一句“少瞧不起人”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 哈！这么一想，还真想赐他一句“少瞧不起人”。
Italian (IT): Ah! A rifletterci in quest'ottica, volevo che la smettesse di sottovalutarci.
Turkish (TR): Ha! Böyle düşündükten sonra, o göte beni bu kadar hafife almamasını söylemek istiyorum.

Umineko Project (UP): Who would dance to that tune? If I'm told "Please be scared", I'm not just gonna say "Really? Sure thing!"
Steam (ST): Who'd just dance to that tune? If you're told "Please be scared", you can't just say "Really? Sure thing!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Who would just dance to that tune? If you're told 'Please be scared', you can't just say 'Really? Sure thing!'
PC Japanese (JP): 誰が踊るかよ、ビビって下さいって言われて、ハイそうですかというわけにゃ行かねぇぜ。
Russian (RU): Да кто будет танцевать под такую дудку? Если тебе говорят: "Давай, бойся!", — ты не можешь просто взять и ответить: "Не вопрос!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quem dançaria nesse ritmo? Se me dissessem "Por favor, fique assustado", eu não iria dizer "Mesmo? Pode deixar!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 誰會被你擺佈啊，我可不會被你一句“快害怕吧”，就嚇得回答“好啊就這樣吧”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 谁会被你摆布啊，我可不会被你一句“快害怕吧”，就吓得回答“好啊就这样吧”。

Turkish (TR): Bu melodiyle kim dans eder ki? Eğer bana "Lütfen kork" denirse, "Gerçekten mi? Tabii! demeyeceğim."

Umineko Project (UP): ...When someone tells the great Ushiromiya Battler "Entrance This Way", I'm the kind of guy who'll start wanting to sneak in through the window!
Steam (ST): ...When someone tells the great Ushiromiya Battler "the entrance is right here", I'm the kind of guy who'll start wanting to sneak in through the window!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...When someone tells the great Ushiromiya Battler 'the entrance is right here', I'm the kind of guy who'll start wanting to sneak in through the window!
PC Japanese (JP): …この右代宮戦人、入口はコチラと言われたら、窓から入り込みたくなる性分と来らぁ！
Russian (RU): ...Когда кто‐то говорит великому Уширомии Баттлеру: "Вход вот здесь", — у меня сразу возникает желание залезть через окно!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Quando alguém diz ao grande Ushiromiya Battler "Entrada Por Aqui", eu sou o tipo do cara que vai querer entrar pela janela!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …如果有人告訴我入口在這邊，依我右代宮戰人的性格，可是會想要從窗口爬進去的！
Chinese Simplified (CN): …如果有人告诉我入口在这边，依我右代宫战人的性格，可是会想要从窗口爬进去的！
Italian (IT): Io, Battler Ushiromiya, sono quel tipo di persona che se gli si dice: ‘l'ingresso si trova qui’, entra attraverso la finestra!
Turkish (TR): ...Birisi büyük Ushiromiya Battler'a "Giriş Bu Taraf" dediğinde, ben pencereden içeri gizlice girmek isteyecek türden bir adamım!

Umineko Project (UP): The next thing that had me concerned was the attempt at a magic circle on the shutter.
Steam (ST): The next thing that had me concerned was that so-called magic circle on the shutter.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The next thing that had me concerned was the shape of the magic circle on the shutter.
PC Japanese (JP): 次に気になるのは、シャッターの魔法陣もどきだ。
Russian (RU): Следующим, что заставило меня задуматься, была форма магического круга на подъёмной двери.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A próxima coisa que me chamou a atenção foi o círculo mágico desenhado sobre o {i:shutter}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接下來讓我在意的，是捲閘門上的那個像是魔法陣的圖形。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接下来让我在意的，是卷闸门上的那个像是魔法阵的图形。
Italian (IT): Un'altra cosa che mi incuriosiva era lo stile del cerchio magico sulla saracinesca...
Turkish (TR): Beni endişelendiren bir sonraki şey ise kepenge boyanan büyülü çember hamlesiydi.

Umineko Project (UP): ...It was a genuine magic circle, declared authentic by even Maria, who had demonstrated that her knowledge of the occult rivaled Grandfather's.
Steam (ST): ...As Maria, who had shown that her knowledge of the occult rivaled Grandfather's, had recognized, that magic circle was genuine.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As Maria, who had shown that her knowledge of the occult rivaled Grandfather's, had recognized, that magic circle was genuine.
PC Japanese (JP): …オカルトに関しちゃ、祖父さま並みの知識を持っていることを披露してくれた真里亞も認める、本格派魔法陣と来た。
Russian (RU): ...Мария, продемонстрировавшая, что её знания в области оккультизма могут соперничать со знаниями дедушки, признала круг как подлинный.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Era um círculo mágico genuíno, declarado autêntico até mesmo pela Maria, que tinha demonstrado que seus conhecimentos de ocultismo rivalizavam com os do vovô.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是個正統派魔法陣。就連給我們展示過不遜於爺爺的神秘學知識的真里亞，都認可了它。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是个正统派魔法阵。就连给我们展示过不逊于爷爷的神秘学知识的真里亚，都认可了它。
Italian (IT): Se Maria, che aveva dimostrato una conoscenza dell'occulto paragonabile a quella di nostro nonno, lo aveva riconosciuto, quel cerchio magico era autentico.
Turkish (TR): ...Bu gerçek bir büyülü çemberdi ve okült bilgisinin Büyükbabamınkine rakip olduğunu kanıtlayan Maria tarafından bile gerçek ilan edilmişti.

Umineko Project (UP): They must have drawn that thing in pitch‐black darkness while holding an umbrella in one hand, and it must have taken them a lot of time—that's a formidable amount of hard work and attention to detail.
Steam (ST): They must have drawn that thing in pitch-black darkness, taking a lot of time and holding an umbrella in one hand. Isn't that amount of hard work and perfectionism impressive?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They must have drawn that thing in pitch-black darkness, taking a lot of time and holding an umbrella in one hand. Isn't that amount of hard work and perfectionism impressive?
PC Japanese (JP): そんなものを、傘を片手に真っ暗な中、時間を掛けて書いたってんだから、その手間と凝り性には恐れ入るねぇ。
Russian (RU): Его, должно быть, нарисовали в кромешной тьме, держа зонтик в одной руке, из‐за чего это отняло уйму времени. Разве не впечатляет, какая непростая работа была проделана и с каким совершенством она была выполнена?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O culpado deve ter desenhado aquilo no meio da escuridão completa enquanto segurava um guarda‐chuva em uma das mãos, e isso deve ter deixado ele ocupado por um bom tempo — é uma formidável quantidade de trabalho duro e atenção aos detalhes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這東西可是在只手撐傘，周圍一片漆黑的情況下，花了不少時間才畫上去的，這麼不辭辛苦的毅力還真讓人有點佩服。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这东西可是在只手撑伞，周围一片漆黑的情况下，花了不少时间才画上去的，这么不辞辛苦的毅力还真让人有点佩服。
Italian (IT): Era impressionante l'impegno e la meticolosità impiegati, dato che il colpevole aveva impiegato tempo per disegnarlo nell'oscurità più totale, mentre teneva con una mano il suo ombrello.
Turkish (TR): Bu şeyi zifiri karanlıkta bir ellerinde şemsiye tutarken çizmiş olmalılar, ve bu çok zamanlarını almış olmalı—bu müthiş bir sıkı çalışma ve detaylara gösterilen dikkat demek.

Umineko Project (UP): What purpose would have been worth all of that effort?
Steam (ST): What purpose would've been worth all of that effort?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): それだけの手間を掛けた意味は何だ？
Russian (RU): Какая цель стоила подобных усилий?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por qual motivo ele se esforçaria tanto para isso?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如此費力費心到底有著什麼意義？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如此费力费心到底有着什么意义？
Italian (IT): A che scopo impegnarsi fino a tanto...?
Turkish (TR): Hangi amaç tüm bu çabaya değebilir ki?

Umineko Project (UP): ...If something related to the occult happened in this mansion, most likely, we would all automatically suspect the involvement of Grandfather.
Steam (ST): ...If we were looking for a fan of the occult in this mansion, most likely, all of us would naturally suspect Grandfather.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...If we were looking for a fan of the occult in this mansion, most likely, all of us would naturally doubt Grandfather.
PC Japanese (JP): …この屋敷でオカルト的なものがあったら、俺たちはほぼ自動的に祖父さまの関与を疑うだろう。
Russian (RU): ...Если что‐то относящееся к оккультизму произошло бы в этом особняке, наиболее вероятно, все мы бы заподозрили причастность дедушки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Se algo relacionado com o oculto acontecer nessa mansão, nós automaticamente suspeitaríamos que o vovô estaria envolvido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …在這大屋裡要是出現了和神秘學相關的東西的話，幾乎我們所有人都會自動懷疑爺爺有所參與吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …在这大屋里要是出现了和神秘学相关的东西的话，几乎我们所有人都会自动怀疑爷爷有所参与吧。
Italian (IT): Se nella villa c'era qualcosa connesso all'occulto, si sarebbe quasi automaticamente sospettato del nonno.
Turkish (TR): ...Bu malikanede okültizmle ilgili bir şey olsaydı, büyük olasılıkla hepimiz otomatik olarak Büyükbabanın bu işe karıştığından şüphelenirdik.

Umineko Project (UP): Did they want to "make us think Grandfather was involved"?
Steam (ST): Did they want to "make us think Grandfather was involved"?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Did they want to 'make us think Grandfather was involved?'
PC Japanese (JP): 俺たちに、“祖父さまが関わっていると思わせたい”ってのか？
Russian (RU): Они хотели, чтобы мы "начали задумываться о причастности дедушки"?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por acaso ele queria "fazer com que pensássemos que o vovô estava envolvido"?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是想“讓我們認為這和爺爺有關”嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是想“让我们认为这和爷爷有关”吗？
Italian (IT): Che volesse {i:farci pensare che nostro nonno fosse coinvolto}?
Turkish (TR): "Büyükbabanın işin içinde olduğunu düşünmemizi" mi istediler?

Umineko Project (UP): But if that was all they wanted, they could have just drawn any old scribble that looked like a magic circle.
Steam (ST): But if that's all they wanted, they could've just drawn any old scribble that looked like a magic circle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): だが、それだけが目的なら、魔法陣風のいい加減な落書きでもよかったはずだ。
Russian (RU): Но, если бы они хотели лишь этого, им достаточно было бы нарисовать любую картинку, напоминавшую магический круг.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas se isso era tudo que ele queria, ele simplesmente poderia fazer uns rabiscos que se parecessem com um círculo mágico.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，若是目的只有這個的話，隨便畫得像是魔法陣不就好了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，若是目的只有这个的话，随便画得像是魔法阵不就好了。
Italian (IT): Ma se era tutto ciò a cui il colpevole ambiva, avrebbe potuto scarabocchiare un cerchio magico qualsiasi.
Turkish (TR): Ama tek istedikleri bu olsaydı, büyülü bir çembere benzeyen herhangi bir eski karalama çizebilirlerdi.

Umineko Project (UP): It wasn't like any of us amateurs could tell the difference between genuine and fake.
Steam (ST): It wasn't like any of us amateurs would be able to tell the difference between genuine and fake.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It wasn't like any of us amateurs could be able to tell the difference between genuine and fake.
PC Japanese (JP): どうせ俺たち素人にはそれが本格派かデタラメかなんて理解できないんだからな。
Russian (RU): Такие дилетанты как мы вряд ли смогли бы отличить подлинник от фальшивки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não é como se um de nós, amadores, conseguíssemos dizer a diferença entre um genuíno e um falso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 反正我們外行人搞不懂這是正統派還是隨手亂畫的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 反正我们外行人搞不懂这是正统派还是随手乱画的。
Italian (IT): Tanto noi ignoranti in materia non potevamo capire la differenza tra uno autentico e uno falso...
Turkish (TR): Biz amatörler gerçek ile sahte arasındaki farkı anlayamazdık.

Umineko Project (UP): ...However, this magic circle was genuine, and furthermore, it had even been written in Hebrew.
Steam (ST): ...However, this magic circle was genuine, and furthermore, it had even been written in Hebrew.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …しかし、魔法陣は本格派、しかもヘブライ語とやらでまで書かれてるって話だ。
Russian (RU): ...Однако этот магический круг был подлинным, и более того, он содержал написанные на иврите слова.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...No entanto, esse círculo mágico é genuíno e, além disso, foi até escrito em hebraico.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …可是，魔法陣卻畫得很正統，甚至連希伯來語都寫上去了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …可是，魔法阵却画得很正统，甚至连希伯来语都写上去了。
Italian (IT): Ma il cerchio magico era autentico, e per di più presentava anche scritte in ebraico...
Turkish (TR): ...Ancak bu büyülü çember gerçekti ve dahası İbranice yazılmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): .........So this magic circle...had a message “that could only be understood by someone with knowledge of the occult”.
Steam (ST): ......So this magic circle had a message... "that could only be understood by someone with knowledge of the occult".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........So this magic circle had a message 'that could only be understood by someone with knowledge of the occult'.
PC Japanese (JP): ………つまり、この魔法陣は、“オカルトの知識のある人間にだけは読み取れる”メッセージ性があるってことだ。
Russian (RU): .........Выходит, этот магический круг заключал в себе послание... "которое мог понять только тот, кто разбирался в оккультизме".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Então esse círculo mágico...tem uma mensagem “que só poderia ser entendida por alguém que tem conhecimentos sobre ocultismo”.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………也就是說，這個魔法陣傳達的信息裡，包含了“只有了解神秘學知識的人才能讀懂”這點。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………也就是说，这个魔法阵传达的信息里，包含了“只有了解神秘学知识的人才能读懂”这点。
Italian (IT): Quindi quel cerchio magico conteneva un messaggio... {i:che poteva essere compreso solo da chi conosceva l'occulto}.
Turkish (TR): .........Yani bu büyülü çember...“sadece okült bilgisi olan biri tarafından anlaşılabilecek” bir mesaj içeriyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): Messages are a form of communication.{n}......You send them, and hope for a reaction from the other party.
Steam (ST): A message is a form of communication. ......By sending it, they were hoping for a reaction.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This message was a form of communication.......By sending it, they were hoping for a reaction.
PC Japanese (JP): メッセージってのはコミュニケーションのひとつだ。……送ったら、相手からのリアクションを期待するものでもある。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): メッセージってのはコミュニケーションのひとつだ。{n}……送ったら、相手からのリアクションを期待するものでもある。
Russian (RU): Послания — это средство общения.{n}......Послав его, они надеялись на ответную реакцию.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mensagens são uma forma de comunicação.{n}......Você as manda e espera por uma reação do receptor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 傳遞信息是溝通方式之一。{n}……傳遞出信息後，也會期待對方有所反應。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 传递信息是沟通方式之一。{n}……传递出信息后，也会期待对方有所反应。
Italian (IT): Questo messaggio era un mezzo per comunicare con noi... Mandandolo, sperava in una risposta da parte dei suoi destinatari...
Turkish (TR): Mesajlar bir iletişim şeklidir.{n}......Gönderirsiniz ve karşı taraftan bir tepki beklersiniz.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Reaction?{n}.........For some reason, we couldn't find Grandfather now.
Steam (ST): ...A reaction? ......For some reason, we couldn't find Grandfather now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Reaction?.........For some reason, we couldn't find Grandfather now.
PC Japanese (JP): …リアクション？………祖父さまは今、どういうわけか姿が見えない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …リアクション？{n}………祖父さまは今、どういうわけか姿が見えない。
Russian (RU): ...Реакцию?{n}.........По какой‐то причине мы сейчас не могли отыскать дедушку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Reação?{n}.........Por algum motivo, não conseguimos encontrar o vovô ainda.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …反應？{n}………爺爺目前不知為何不見踪影。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …反应？{n}………爷爷目前不知为何不见踪影。
Italian (IT): Una risposta...? Per qualche motivo, non riuscivamo a trovare il nonno.
Turkish (TR): ...Tepki mi?{n}.........Bir nedenden dolayı, Büyükbabayı bulamadık.

Umineko Project (UP): I don't know how Grandfather could have managed to see the magic circle on the shutter, ...but had he chosen to hide himself in reaction to that sign...?
Steam (ST): I don't know how Grandfather might've spotted the magic circle on the shutter, but did he choose to hide himself in reaction to that...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I couldn't know how Grandfather might have seen the magic circle on the shutter, but had he chosen to hide himself in reaction to that sign...?
PC Japanese (JP): 祖父さまがどうやってあのシャッターの魔法陣を見たのかは知らないが、…その結果のリアクションとして姿を消した、ということなのか…？
Russian (RU): Я не знал, мог ли дедушка увидеть этот магический круг на подъёмной двери...... но, может, увидев его, он решил спрятаться?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não sei como o vovô poderia ter visto o círculo mágico no {i:shutter}, ...mas ele escolheu se esconder a reagir a esse sinal...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然不知道爺爺是怎樣看到捲閘門上的魔法陣的，…但他的消失，可以看作是他看到魔法陣後的反應嗎…？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然不知道爷爷是怎样看到卷闸门上的魔法阵的，…但他的消失，可以看作是他看到魔法阵后的反应吗…？
Italian (IT): Non sapevo in che modo nostro nonno avesse potuto vedere il cerchio magico sulla saracinesca, ma se si fosse nascosto in risposta a quel messaggio...?
Turkish (TR): Büyükbabam kepenge çizilen büyülü daireyi görmeyi nasıl başarmış olabilir bilmiyorum, ...ama buna tepki olarak kendini saklamayı mı seçmişti...?

Umineko Project (UP): No, was it a trap to make us suspect Grandfather's involvement?
Steam (ST): No, was it a trap to make us suspect that Grandfather had participated?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No, was it a trap to make us suspect that Grandfather had participated?
PC Japanese (JP): いや、そう見せ掛けて俺たちに祖父さまの関与を疑わせようという罠なのか。
Russian (RU): Нет, может, это ловушка, цель которой заставить нас заподозрить причастность дедушки?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não, não seria essa uma armadilha para nos fazer suspeitar que o vovô estaria envolvido?

Chinese Simplified (CN): 不，还是说这其实是个陷阱，犯人是故意做出这种假象，好让我们去怀疑爷爷参与其中吗？

Turkish (TR): Hayır, Büyükbabanın bu işe karıştığından şüphelenmemiz için bir tuzak mıydı?

Umineko Project (UP): ...You could read it either way—damn, that's annoying.
Steam (ST): ...You could read it either way, damn that's annoying.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...You could read it either way, damn that's annoying.
PC Japanese (JP): …どっちにも読めるぜ、うぜえ真似じゃねぇか。
Russian (RU): ...Это можно истолковать и так, и так. Блин, вот зараза.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Você poderia entender dessa forma — droga, isso é irritante.

Chinese Simplified (CN): …两种意思都解读得出来，真他妈有一手。

Turkish (TR): ...Bunu her iki şekilde de düşünebilirsiniz—lanet olsun, bu sinir bozucu.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......What kind of reaction was the culprit hoping to get out of us by showing this imitation of the occult...?

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Que tipo de reação o culpado espera de nós mostrando essa imitação de ocultismo...?

Steam (ST): Somehow, that felt like the culprit's weak point...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De alguma forma, isso soa como o ponto fraco do culpado...

Umineko Project (UP): A section of {f:5:Beatrice}'s letter that Maria had read aloud during last night's dinner sprang back into my mind.
Steam (ST): The letter from {f:5:Beatrice} that Maria had read aloud during last night's dinner sprang back into my mind.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The letter from Beatrice that Maria had read aloud during last night's dinner sprang back into my mind.

Umineko Project (UP): ......The part that said "I ask that you enjoy your battle of wits".
Steam (ST): ...This was a freak who'd asked us to enjoy a battle of wits.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......This person was satisfied with playing a battle of wits.

Russian (RU): ......Его часть, в которой нам предлагалось "наслаждаться битвой умов".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A parte que diz "eu peço que vocês aproveitem a sua batalha de inteligência".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……就是“盡情享受智慧比試”什麼的讓人不爽的那段。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……就是“尽情享受智慧比试”什么的让人不爽的那段。

Turkish (TR): ......"Zeka savaşınızın tadını sonuna kadar çıkarmanızı rica ediyorum" yazan kısım.

Umineko Project (UP): Sounds like fun. This is a battle of wits between us and the witch.
Steam (ST): Isn't that interesting? This is a battle of wits between us and the witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Isn't that interesting? This is a battle of wits between us and the witch.
PC Japanese (JP): 面白いじゃねぇか。こいつは俺たちと魔女さまの知恵比べだ。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso soa como uma diversão. Essa é uma batalha intelectual entre nós e a bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這倒有趣。這是我們和魔女的智慧比試。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这倒有趣。这是我们和魔女的智慧比试。
Italian (IT): Interessante, non è vero? Questa era una gara d'ingegno tra noi e la somma strega.
Turkish (TR): Kulağa eğlenceli geliyor. Bu cadı ile bizim aramızdaki bir zeka savaşı.

Umineko Project (UP): Which will be first, us being swallowed up by your occult games?
Steam (ST): Will we be sucked up by her occult game first?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Will we be sucked up by her occult game first?

Steam (ST): ...There's a whole day until the typhoon passes. Why not enjoy ourselves...?!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......There's a whole day until the typhoon passes. Why not enjoy ourselves...?!

Turkish (TR): ......Tayfun geçene kadar koca bir gün var.{n}Neden keyfimize bakmıyoruz...?!

Umineko Project (UP): I finally noticed that the inside of the parlor had gone quiet again.
Steam (ST): I finally noticed that the inside of the parlor had gone quiet again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 気付けば、客間の中は静まり返っていた。

Umineko Project (UP): Everyone had sunk into their favorite sofas, some deep in thought, some irritated, some depressed.
Steam (ST): Everyone had sunk into their favorite sofas, some deep in thought, some irritated, some acting depressed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Everyone had sunk into their favorite sofas, some deep in thought, some irritated, some acting depressed.

Umineko Project (UP): Maria was once again enjoying the television as if she had never left it.
Steam (ST): Maria was once again enjoying the TV as if she'd never left it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maria was once again enjoying the television as if she had never left it.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞はさっきからずっとそうであったかのように、再びテレビの前に戻り観賞を続けている。

Turkish (TR): Maria yine televizyondan hiç ayrılmamış gibi keyif alıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...It looked like she found the commercials more fun than the boring program, and she happily yelled "uu‐uu" and giggled.
Steam (ST): It looked like she found the commercials more fun than the boring program, and she happily yelled "uu-uu-" and giggled.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It looked like she found the commercials more fun than the boring program, and she happily yelled 'uu-uu-' and giggled.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Parecia que ela estava achando os comerciais mais divertidos do que o programa chato, e alegremente gritando "uu‐uu" e rindo.

Turkish (TR): ...Reklamları sıkıcı programdan daha eğlenceli bulmuşa benziyordu ve mutlu bir şekilde "uu-uu" diye bağırıp kıkırdıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): I stared at each person's appearance in turn.{n}If there isn't a 19th person, .........the culprit must be in this room.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): I stared at each person's appearance in turn. If there wasn't a 19th person, .........the culprit must be in this room.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Right now, Natsuhi oba-san was searching the mansion with the servants though, wasn't she?

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Afinal, também tem a possibilidade da tia Natsuhi estar por trás disso, ...e nós ainda não conseguimos negar a possibilidade de um dos serviçais ser o assassino.

Steam (ST): Of course, it's not a small mansion, but isn't this taking a little too long just to walk around, checking the windows and doors...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, it's not a small mansion, but isn't this taking a little too long just to walk around, checking the windows and doors...?

PC Japanese (JP): 「手に入れられたばかりの頃は、大層気に入られておりまして。撃つより、薬莢を出す動作が面白いらしくて、裏の森でいろいろとカッコつけて遊んでおられたもんですよ。ほっほっほっほ…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「手に入れられたばかりの頃は、大層気に入られておりまして。撃つより、薬莢を出す動作が面白いらしくて、裏の森でいろいろとカッコつけて遊んでおられたもんですよ。ほっほっほっほ…」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi

Umineko Project (UP): .........It was the doubt that had been repeated endlessly since last night's dinner, with the letter from the witch who called herself {f:5:Beatrice}.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........It was the doubt that had been repeated endlessly since last night's dinner, with the letter from the witch who called herself Beatrice.
PC Japanese (JP): ………昨夜の晩餐でベアトリーチェと名乗る魔女からの手紙を受け取って以来、何度も繰り返されている疑問だ。
Russian (RU): .........То самое сомнение, бесконечно повторявшееся с ужина прошлой ночью, с письма от ведьмы, назвавшей себя {f:5:Беатриче}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Essa é uma dúvida que vem se repetindo infinitamente desde o jantar da noite passada, com a carta da bruxa, que se declara ser a {f:5:Beatrice}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………這是在昨晚晚餐上收到自稱是貝阿朵莉切的魔女送來的信以來，反反覆覆提出過好多次的疑問。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………这是在昨晚晚餐上收到自称是贝阿朵莉切的魔女送来的信以来，反反复复提出过好多次的疑问。
Italian (IT): Era un dubbio che si stava propagando all'infinto, a partire da quando, durante la cena della notte scorsa, avevamo ricevuto la lettera della strega che si faceva chiamare {f:5:Beatrice}...
Turkish (TR): .........Bu, dün geceki yemekten beri, kendine {f:5:Beatrice} diyen cadıdan gelen mektupla birlikte durmadan tekrarlanan bir şüpheydi.

Umineko Project (UP): ......So was the culprit among us, or not.{n}And did the witch {f:5:Beatrice} exist, or not.
Steam (ST): ......So was the culprit among us, or not? And did the witch {f:5:Beatrice} exist, or not?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......So was the culprit among us, or not. And did Beatrice exist, or not.
PC Japanese (JP): ……果たして、俺たちの中に犯人はいるのか、いないのか。そして、魔女ベアトリーチェは存在するのか、しないのか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……果たして、俺たちの中に犯人はいるのか、いないのか。{n}そして、魔女ベアトリーチェは存在するのか、しないのか。
Russian (RU): ......Так был ли преступник среди нас или нет?{n}И существует ли {f:5:Беатриче} или нет?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Então o culpado está entre nós, ou não?{n}E a {f:5:Beatrice} existe, ou não?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……到底，犯人是在我們之中，還是之外。{n}還有，魔女貝阿朵莉切究竟是存在，還是不存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……到底，犯人是在我们之中，还是之外。{n}还有，魔女贝阿朵莉切究竟是存在，还是不存在。
Italian (IT): Quindi il colpevole era uno di noi, oppure no? E {f:5:Beatrice} esisteva, oppure no?
Turkish (TR): ......Suçlu aramızda mıydı, yoksa değil miydi?{n}Ve cadı {f:5:Beatrice} var mıydı, yoksa yok muydu?

Umineko Project (UP): If you assumed that something as stupid as a witch couldn't exist, it was the same as saying that one of these relatives here, who shared a common bloodline, was the culprit.
Steam (ST): If you assume that something as stupid as a witch can't exist, you're basically saying that one of these relatives here, who share a common bloodline, is the culprit.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If you assume that something as stupid as a witch couldn't exist, it was the same as saying that one of these relatives here, who shared a common bloodline, was the culprit.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女なんて馬鹿なものがいるわけがないと言うのなら、それはつまり、ここにいる血を分けた親族たちの中に犯人がいると言うのと同じだ。
Russian (RU): Если допустить, что нечто настолько глупое, как ведьмы, не может существовать, то это было равносильно признанию того, что один из родственников здесь, в жилах которых текла одна кровь, был преступником.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assumir que algo tão estúpido como uma bruxa não existe, é o mesmo que dizer que um de nós, que compartilhamos o sangue em comum, é o culpado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 若要說魔女這種傻玩意根本不可能有，那就等於是在說，犯人就在這些有血緣關係的親戚們中一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 若要说魔女这种傻玩意根本不可能有，那就等于是在说，犯人就在这些有血缘关系的亲戚们中一样。
Italian (IT): Affermare che esseri come le streghe non potessero esistere, era come dire che il colpevole fosse uno dei parenti lì presenti, con cui condividevamo lo stesso sangue.
Turkish (TR): Eğer cadı gibi aptalca bir şeyin var olamayacağını varsayarsanız, bu, ortak bir kanı paylaşan bu akrabalardan birinin suçlu olduğunu söylemekle aynı şeydi.

Umineko Project (UP): If you didn't like that, it would be much more comfortable to simply accept the fairy tale about the witch.
Steam (ST): If that was too unpleasant, it'd be much more comfortable to simply accept the fairy tale-like character of the witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If you didn't like that, it would be much more comfortable to simply accept the fairy tale about the witch.
PC Japanese (JP): それが嫌なら、魔女なんてお伽噺の中の存在を認める方がはるかに気楽だ。
Russian (RU): Если же тебе такой расклад не по вкусу, то будет куда удобнее просто принять эту сказку про ведьму.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se você não gosta disso, então é muito mais simples e confortável assumir esse conto de fadas sobre uma bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要是不願這麼想的話，承認童話中的魔女確實存在，則要輕鬆得多。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要是不愿这么想的话，承认童话中的魔女确实存在，则要轻松得多。
Italian (IT): Se non si voleva ammetterlo, sarebbe stato molto più conveniente accettare l'esistenza di streghe e altre creature uscite dalle favole...
Turkish (TR): Bu hoşunuza gitmediyse, cadı hakkındaki peri masalını kabul etmek çok daha rahat olurdu.

Umineko Project (UP): ............Did a witch do it?{n}Draw that weird magic circle and sacrifice those people?
Steam (ST): .........A witch? A witch drawing a bizarre magic circle and offering human sacrifices?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ............And the witch? Did she draw that weird magic circle and sacrifice those people?

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …………魔女が？{n}怪しげな魔法陣を描いて生贄を捧げた？

Umineko Project (UP): If I could only accept that rubbish, ...I would be able to completely trust everyone in this room.
Steam (ST): If I could accept that rubbish, ...I'd be able to trust all the people in this room.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se eu ao menos pudesse aceitar essa besteira, ...eu seria capaz de confiar completamente em todos nesta sala.

Steam (ST): However, damn common sense got in the way. ...It kept repeating that witches don't exist.

Umineko Project (UP): In the middle of the seemingly endless rain, none of us could break our silence...
Steam (ST): In the middle of the seemingly endless rain, none of us could break the silence...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the middle of the seemingly endless rain, none of us could break our silence...
PC Japanese (JP): いつ止むとも知れぬ雨音の中で、俺たちは沈黙を拭えない…。
Russian (RU): В центре этого кажущегося бесконечным дождя никто не смел нарушить воцарившееся молчание...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No meio dessa chuva, que aparentava ser interminável, nenhum de nós conseguiu quebrar esse silêncio...
